item.title: Configuration Management Analyst (ITIL/ServiceNow)
item.description:
• Configuration Management Analyst (ITIL/ServiceNow)

      North York, Ontario
        Waterloo, Ontario
      Apply

      • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

        Job Description:

        Are you interested to contribute to one of the most advanced Configuration Management environments in the industry according to Gartner? Would you like to be part of the team that plans to make it even better?

        As a member of the ITIL Service Configuration Management team at an intermediate level, you will assist in the design, evolution / continuous improvement and on-going maintenance of the Configuration Management Database (CMDB), eco-system, and supporting environment. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with IT service providers, infrastructure and application team subject matter experts and business areas to build and maintain the Configuration Management System and its integration with various business processes.

        Main Accountabilities:

        Provides process/technical expertise and facilitates day-to-day Configuration Management operational activities, including:

        • Planning, Identification, Control, Monitoring, and Verification of CIs
        • Promotes awareness, education and process adherence of Configuration Management policies, processes, procedures and compliance controls throughout the organization.
        • Works with CI Owners to maintain/improve data quality, accuracy, completeness and value generation for all managed Configuration Items by identifying, recording and validating critical configuration data through CI governance process.
        • Identifies process improvements, ongoing and evolving needs of supporting IT and Business processes by leveraging best practices to strengthen Configuration Management System and Configuration Management Process.
        • Plans, assesses and assists in driving CMDB scope expansion and discovery capabilities to include emerging technologies.
        • Contributes to development of training program, performs reporting and provides statistical/audit information on process operations.
        • Assists in development and maintenance of process artifacts.
        • Monitors CI compliance and adherence to the process.
        • Leads investigation into discrepancies to improve data accuracy.
        • Provides ongoing process and tool support.
        • Participates in requirements gathering sessions, design and testing activities in support of ongoing ServiceNow tool enhancements to improve/mature CMDB.
        • Works with internal ServiceNow support team to both maintain and improve the Discovery process and integrations.
        • Works with IT Operations, IT Asset Management, Service Level Management, Vulnerability Management, Data Governance and Application/Infrastructure teams to continually improve and support their processes while leveraging the CMDB.
        • Liaises with stakeholders to design, govern and implement interfaces with other applications/systems that consume or provide CMDB data.
        • Monitors the operational efficiency of the process, reviews feedback and identifies opportunities for continuous improvement.
        • Performs Service Modeling and Dependency Mapping. Works with IT and Business representatives to define and add services to the CMDB by identifying what IT components make up a service and how they interrelate.
        • Stays current on newly deployed technologies within our global organization and follows industry trends.

        Competencies:

        • Minimum of three (3) years of experience working with Configuration Management and CMDB in an IT environment.
        • Must have a technical background with high-level understanding of IT infrastructure and concepts (Servers, Network Gear, Storage, Virtualization, Clustering and Cloud) and application environments (Application/Web Services and Databases).
        • Working knowledge of ITIL and ITSM processes and methodologies.
        • Excellent verbal and written communication skills to both technical and non-technical audiences.
        • Effective analytical and problem solving skills. Ability to collect, organize, analyze and disseminate significant amounts of data with attention to detail and accuracy.
        • Strong influencing and negotiating skills.
        • Demonstrated ability to build relationships and foster communication between various individual people, teams, and organizations.
        • Proven ability to work well both independently and collaboratively as a member of a team.
        • Self-motivated, self-directed, strong organizational and time-management skills.
        • ITIL v3/v4 Foundations certification.
        • Technical proficiency with ServiceNow – Configuration Module is preferred.

        Unique Requirements:

        • Occasional weekend work required to facilitate testing activities

        What’s in it for you?

        • Named 2021 “Best Places to Work” by Glassdoor
        • Work and professional development that is united by our Purpose: to help Clients and Employees achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives
        • A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture
        • Be part of our continuous improvement journey in developing the next greatest digital enterprise experience.
        • Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data
        • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security
        • A common sense dress code, where you decide how you dress based on your day
        • The opportunity to move along a variety of career paths with amazing networking potential
        • Flex hours and periodic work from home options.

        The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

        Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

        Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

        At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

        We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

item.title: Office Administrator
item.description:
• Office Administrator

      Waterloo, Ontario
    Apply

    • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

      Job Description:

      Please note this is a 1 year contract position.

      The Office Administrator plays a key role in ensuring effective mail handling, categorization, scanning, and data completion of documents correctly and efficiently. The successful applicant will work in a team environment to ensure service standards are met and strict quality targets are adhered to.


      What will you do?

      On a regular basis, this role will rotate between sorting mail (physical and electronic), prepping documents, scanning documents and data entry.

      Sorting

      • This involves mail handling, including the distribution of documents to internal customer departments, classification of document into subcategories, printing from databases, retrieval of documents from 3rd party websites with occasional document preparation

      Prepping

      • The preparation of documents to ensure the item is successfully scanned to ensure strict physical document quality standards are met

      • Ensuring that all documents received are handled efficiently and document exceptions are expedited to the appropriate departments in a timely manner

      Scanning

      • Ensure the physical document is converted into a digitized image by adhering to standard processes

      • By scanning the documents correctly in a timely manner, the administrator contributes to meeting service levels agreements between Canadian Document Services and client areas.

      Indexing

      • Through accurate key completion, the representative is responsible for ensuring information from the document is converted into data

      • Ensures all documents adhere to the Reasonable Estimate (RE’s) that have been set for each client

      What do you need to succeed?

      • Able to work within structured supervisory guidelines 

      • Able to maintain a high level of productivity, accuracy and attention to detail at all times

      • Able to work in a fast-paced environment of multiple priorities and conflicting deadlines

      • Support Service Level Agreements (SLA’s) for business partners

      • Able to recognize opportunities to initiate change that will increase the department’s efficiency

      What’s in it for you?

      • Being a member of the Sun Life family, a group of people united by our Purpose: to help Clients and Employees achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives

      • A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture

      • An environment of continuous learning and improvement

      The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.

We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

      Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

      At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

      We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

item.title: Client Experience & Insights Specialist
item.description:
• Client Experience & Insights Specialist

      Waterloo, Ontario
        Toronto, Ontario
      Apply

      • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

        Job Description:

        Sun Life Financial is seeking a motivated individual with UX design, research and analytics experience to join our Marketing Strategy team in our Marketing and Business Development area.  You will be responsible for guiding large-scale quantitative and qualitative research and applying this research to create remarkable and progressive digital experiences for a variety of audiences. You will work collaboratively with fellow members of the team to apply research findings and conceptualize design and prototype ideas for implementation on multiple digital platforms.

        What will you do?

        UX research and analytics:

        • Use research to gain a holistic understanding of a user’s needs and help define the problems and build the solutions

        • Work with external agencies to build research proposals and oversee in-depth research projects from start to finish

        • Help gather, analyze and apply insights on marketing strategy projects, specifically Voice of the Advisor

        • Responsible for pulling metrics, build reports to show impact of each engagement

        • Work with various partners to share insights, success, failures and learnings from our Voice of Advisor initiative

        • Share insights with the strategy and operations team; participate in brainstorming and ideation sessions in order to ensure that the advisor is the focus of marketing strategy output

        • Determine the need for user research and user testing. Interpret and review research findings for presentations to project teams 

        • Advocate for data-driven design solutions for web and mobile

        UX design and strategy:

        • Apply user-centered design principles to influence project strategy and direction

        • Develop user scenarios, personas, user flows, design concepts, low and high-fidelity wireframes, and prototypes, UI standards documents, and other design documents as needed

        • Design and deliver elegant and delightful visual elements of a coherent advisor experience

        • Conduct concept and usability testing to iteratively validate and improve design solutions

        • Ensure standards and best practices are appropriately communicated and documented

        • Clearly articulate proposed design and key decisions with stakeholders

        • Actively collaborate as part of the team to ensure designs are feasible and implemented accurately

        What do you need to succeed?

        • Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in user-centered digital design and user experience

        • University degree or certification in User Experience, or equivalent work experience

        • Solid portfolio demonstrating impactful customer experiences, including experience developing digital products from initial concept through to implementation.

        • Design experience ranging across web and mobile (mobile web and native applications)

        • Experience interpreting qualitative and quantitative data in order to help define a problem and solution

        • Familiar working with design systems that consistently scale across platforms

        • Understanding of front-end web development (HTML, CSS, JS, etc.)

        • Strong verbal and writing communication skills with ability to articulate the value of a design choice to users and non-designer stakeholders. Excellent presentation skills

        • Ability to understand the marketing strategy and apply this knowledge to projects

        • Ability to identify trends and patterns and extract meaningful insights from data

        • Experience working with clients and various departments within a team environment.

        • Knowledge of current web standards and the latest trends as well as current accessibility standards

        • Ability to successfully manage and deliver on multiple projects with competing deadlines and priorities

        • Creative problem solving and analytical thinking

        • Able to produce high-quality creative solutions in a fast-paced environment

        • Synthesizes abstract ideas into tangible solutions

        • Passionate about problem solving through research and design

        • Strong sense of ownership and proactively advocates for the end user

        • Open to taking on new challenges and learning new skills

        • Collaborative, curious, empathetic, open-minded, innovative

        • Experience managing relationships with external agencies

        What\'s in it for you?

        • Being a member of the Sun Life family, a group of people united by our Purpose: to help Clients and Employees achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives

        • Being part of our journey in developing the next greatest digital experience

        • Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data

        NOTE: Candidates are expected to bring a portfolio of their past work to highlight their UX accomplishments/experience.

        *LI-NB1

        The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

        Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

        Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

        At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

        We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

item.title: Technology Lead, Internal Audit
item.description:
• Technology Lead, Internal Audit

      Toronto, Ontario
        Sun Life Financial Waterloo King
          Wellesley Hills, Massachusetts
        Apply

        • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

          Job Description:

          Internal Audit is an independent and objective assurance and consulting activity guided by a philosophy of adding value to improve the operations of Sun Life Financial Inc. It assists Sun Life in accomplishing its objectives by bringing a systematic and disciplined approach to evaluate and improve the effectiveness of the organization\'s governance, risk management and internal control processes. 

          The Internal Audit Professional Practice group is responsible for leading the selection and effective use of tools, methodology selection and implementation, and best practices including quality assurance, reporting, and training for the Audit Department worldwide.

          Reporting to the Director, Internal Audit - Professional Practice, the Technology Lead will actively support the department’s initiatives on working differently and translating experiences with tangible digital solutions. This role has two components:

          • Lead the transition of our audit working papers to a GRC tool with a focus on reviewing current practices and implementing efficiencies in the internal audit group. This includes project management with a strong focus on client satisfaction and delivering a successful implementation of our new audit tool.

          • Contribute to driving change in the Audit department by supporting the Director in the implementation of key department strategic initiatives to enhance performance and align with best practices.

          The role provides a unique opportunity to interact with senior level internal audit management and further enhance skills essential in internal audit.

          What will you do?

          Technology Implementation

          • Lead technology projects, including transition into a new GRC  tool, as well as ongoing support to global teams on key and transformational changes

          • Adopt a digital mindset to analyze and challenge current processes and recommend optimal solutions to implement the complexities of the audit cycle

          • Develop project plans and monitor traction to ensure implementation is completed on time and within budget

          • Review business requirements, solicit feedback, and ensure the project meets the audit team\'s needs

          • Liaise with multiple teams and manage communications and relationships to facilitate smooth delivery

          • Develop partnerships and co-ordinate with the Second Line of Defense to ensure consistent and coordinated solutions are implemented

          • Lead training sessions on the new tool to internal audit teams, including assisting in orienting new hires and providing refresher training to current employees and senior management, to help achieve individual and department-wide objectives

          Strategic Initiatives and Thought Leadership

          • Participate in key projects sponsored by senior audit leadership focused on audit transformation, digital mindset, and continuous improvements

          • Use integrated tools and data to provide value add insights, including but not limited to, trends requiring management escalation, develop design to assist audit teams with predictive decision-making, etc.

          • Be curious and explore different audit approaches in the industry to be able to compare current audit practices with a continuous improvement mindset

          • Proactively identify opportunities for efficiency gains through audit tools / approaches and collaboration with global teams in North America, the UK and Asia

          Knowledge Management and Internal Audit Practices

          • Support Director with Internal Audit programs focused on enhancing principles-based methodology, global training, periodic communications, and annual Audit Planning

          • Design and generate reporting as requested from senior management, and facilitate preparation of material for regulatory or external reviews of Internal Audit

          • Develop innovative techniques to identify and complete targeted reviews on areas of interest to senior management, regulators, and hot topics in industry

          • Own the role of point person to assist teams with day-to-day challenges, and manage technology assets including server upgrades, intranet site, and internal reporting

          • Establish internal performance monitoring and review results periodically to recommend changes to Internal Audit methodology and assist with implementing the change

          What do you need to succeed?

          • Working knowledge of key GRC or audit systems, e.g. Archer

          • Experience with managing major system implementations with time-sensitive deliveries

          • Demonstrated ability to team well with peers and to build and maintain relationships with all employee levels

          • Strong technology skills with experience in the use of large volumes of data and MS Office

          • Strong communicator, both verbally and in writing

          • Demonstrated ability to effectively influence key players, and build and maintain relationships

          • Profound sense of ethics and the ability to deal with pressure and resolve conflicts

          • Strong quantitative, analytical, data intuition and problem solving skills

          The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

          Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

          Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

          At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

          We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

          Salary Range:

          73,800/73 800 - 124,100/124 100

          Job Category:

          Business Analysis - Systems

          Posting End Date:

          13/08/2021
        Apply
            Posted 11 Days Ago
              Full time
                JR00042541

              About Us

item.title: Salesforce Application Developer
item.description:
• Salesforce Application Developer

      Toronto, Ontario
    Apply

    • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

      Job Description:

      About the Business:

      Sun Life Financial is a leader and innovator in engaging Canadians through digital channels, putting our clients at the centre of everything we do. The Sun Life Salesforce Centre of Excellence (CoE) Team is a dynamic group of people, building and supporting exciting mission critical solutions for business areas across Sun Life Canada.  The Salesforce.com platform is a key enabler helping us deliver on our Purpose: To help our Clients achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives.

      About the Role:

                                                                                               

      The Salesforce CoE team is growing and looking for a business-minded Salesforce Developer who can work with Salesforce technical lead for complex Salesforce.com implementations. The successful candidate will work closely with business partners and other IT teams to design, develop, and implement Enterprise scale and integrated Salesforce.com solutions.

      What will you do?

      • Contribute to the design and development of Salesforce.com solutions, following internal guidelines and standard processes.
      • Provide thought leadership and recommendations for how all aspects of the Salesforce platform can advance Sun Life’s digital transformation.
      • Work closely with internal business partners as a functional consultant. 
      • Develop and demonstrate Proof of Concept (PoC) and prototype designs while developing a deep understanding of the business opportunity in order to come up with innovative solutions.
      • Provide technical feasibility and effort estimate for proposed deliverables in Salesforce platform
      • Contribute to Salesforce technical governance framework, especially around DevOps practice in Salesforce platform, design and development guideline.
      • Perform post-implementation transition to application operational service team in Sun Life.
      • Maintain and update the necessary system design documentation for applications built in Salesforce platform.

      What you need to succeed:

      • University degree in Computer Science or equivalent.
      • 3+ years of enterprise application design/development experience, including 2+ years in Salesforce Lightning experience configuration, customization, development using Salesforce.com best practices.
      • Deep experience working with many aspects of the Salesforce platform, especially in Financial Services Cloud and Community Cloud (experience with Einstein Analytics also an asset).
      • Proficiency in all aspects of Salesforce.com Lightning development environment including OOTB automation tools, Apex, Triggers, Visual Force, Lightning Components using LWC and SLDS frameworks, data migration approach & tools.
      • Proficiency in integrating Salesforce.com applications with 3rd party system using REST and SOAP web services, event based integration.
      • Software development fundamentals such as knowledge of data structures, object oriented programming, relational database design, and design patterns.
      • Design and development experience using Agile project methodology.
      • Experience with web development technologies like Java, .NET, CSS, JavaScript, HTML, XML, HTML5 Frameworks (Node JS, Bootstrap, Angular etc).
      • Hands-on experience with implementing accessibility compliance web design (i.e., AODA).
      • Experience with development, code management and deployment tools considered an asset (VSCode, GitHub, BitBucket, JIRA, Jenkins, Force.com Migration Tool, ANT Scripting, etc.).
      • Salesforce Certifications:
        • Must Have: Salesforce Certified Administrator, Salesforce Platform Developer 1
        • Nice to Have: Salesforce Platform Developer 2, Salesforce Sales Cloud
          Consultant, Salesforce Community Cloud Consultant

      Preferred skills:

      • Passion, Creativity and Collaboration
      • Self driven and motivated to get results
      • Proven ability to perform design, development, unit testing, implementation and documentation as it relates to Salesforce.com applications
      • Ability to give expert advice and articulate complex ideas and solutions using a variety of media and tools to senior technical and business stakeholders and executives
      • Strong communication skills  (written and verbal) to express ideas, thoughts and questions so that it can be understood by various audiences and meets the customers\' needs
      • Adept at working collaboratively as part of a cross functional team to deliver solutions
      • Adept at working effectively on multi-site teams including offshore teams in India
      • Strong analysis and problem solving skills to break down high-level business requirements into more detail by questioning and probing for clarification
      • Good leadership, planning and consulting skills (business and technical)
      • A strong appreciation of the quickly evolving digital technology landscape and its applicability to businesses and their clients

      Special Notes:

      Occasional weekend / after-hours work may be required to support project implementations, system upgrades and support for production environments.

      What’s in it for you:

      • Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data
      • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security
      • A common sense dress code, where you dictate how you dress based on your day
      • An environment of continuous learning and improvement

      The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

      Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

      Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

      At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

      We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

      Salary Range:

      55,500/55 500 - 91,600/91 600

      Job Category:

      IT - Application Development

      Posting End Date:

      11/08/2021

item.title: Manager, Regulatory Reporting
item.description:
• Manager, Regulatory Reporting

      Toronto, Ontario
    Apply

    • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

      Job Description:

      This role, reporting to the Director, Regulatory Analysis, is a key contributor in the Corporate Finance team responsible for supporting Sun Life’s statutory reporting function. The incumbent will be accountable for leading the delivery of Sun Life’s reporting requirements to various regulatory and institutional bodies globally. Applying broad-based knowledge and expertise in both accounting standards and regulatory guidelines, the Manager will work with business partners, functional areas and technical teams across the organization to provide support and guidance as a key subject matter expert in regulatory reporting. In addition, the role will support the design and implementation of a best-in-class process to centralize and integrate the data collection function across Corporate Finance teams, using existing tools (SAP, Longview, Workiva etc.) and automated workflow capabilities to achieve that outcome.

       

      Are you a self-motivated, results-driven individual with strong analytical and problem-solving skills? Would you like to advance your career in finance, with a passion to lead and drive change to improve operational efficiency? Click APPLY today.

      What will you do?

      • Lead the preparation and review of the quarterly and annual OSFI LIFE-1 returns, including all applicable schedules, as well as various statutory quarterly and annual filings with other regulatory and institutional bodies, including provincial and foreign regulatory bodies, CLHIA, Statistics Canada, etc., partnering with local finance and reporting teams across various Sun Life business groups and functional areas globally to achieve that outcome

      • Support the design, build and implementation of a technology-driven, data collection and integration process, applying the principle of “collect once, use many times” to minimize duplication and satisfy a wide range of users across reporting and analysis functions within Corporate Finance

      • Maintain strong and effective working relationships with regulatory bodies and industry associations, serving as a key liaison to represent Sun Life’s interests in those organizations. Ensure accurate and timely payment of the federal and provincial assessment and license renewal fees in accordance with the related regulations and internal processes

      • Review ongoing changes to federal, provincial, foreign and other regulatory and compliance reporting requirements along with changes in IFRS and Sun Life’s accounting policies to assess any impacts to regulatory reporting

      • Contribute to strategic ad-hoc projects across Corporate Finance, including our adoption of IFRS 17, IFRS 9, the implementation of new accounting systems

      • Identify and execute process improvement initiatives in collaboration with cross-team stakeholders to drive operational efficiencies, building upon a culture of continuous improvement

      • Participate in the accounting for complex transactions and understand associated implications on regulatory reporting

      • Actively coach and develop junior staff (team of 2-3 staff)

      What do you need to succeed?

      • Bachelor\'s degree in Finance or Accounting

      • Accounting designation CPA, CA, CMA or CGA or equivalent

      • 4+ years relevant experience in either public accounting or large, multinational organizations, preferably in the insurance industry

      • Experience with SAP S/4HANA (including Fiori and Analysis for Office) and Aptitude Accounting Hub is an advantage

      • Experience with Oracle general ledger, Longview, Tableau or Workiva wDesk is an advantage  

      What\'s in it for you?

      • 20 vacation days per year

      • Flexible Benefits from the day you join to meet the needs of you and your family

      • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security

      • The opportunity to move along a variety of career paths with amazing networking potential

      • Being a member of the Sun Life family, a group of people united by our Purpose: to help Clients and Employees achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives

      The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

      Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

      Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

      At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

      We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

      67,400/67 400 - 110,100/110 100

      Job Category:

      Finance

      Posting End Date:

      20/08/2021

item.title: Financial Analyst
item.description:
• Financial Analyst

      Toronto, Ontario
        North York, Ontario
      Apply

      • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

        Job Description:

        The Financial Analyst role provides full-time monthly reporting, financial analysis, budgeting & forecasting support for the Sun Life IT team.  Specifically, for the Data and Analytics division. The Financial Analyst will develop key working relationships with members of IT finance and the IT product owners.  This role will partner with these teams to drive successful budgeting, forecasting & monthly reporting of expenses and the associated IT recoveries via chargebacks to users across the organization.  The role requires a motivated individual with high initiative, strong organization and analytical skills, ability to multi-task, excellent communication skills, keen attention to detail, and advanced proficiency with MS Excel and PowerPoint.

        This role reports to the IT Finance Manager.

        What will you do?

        • Drive budgeting, forecasting, financial management and reporting/analytics for IT portfolios within Sun Life

        • Provide value to IT and the business through early identification of financial risks & opportunities and other ad hoc report and analysis

        • Partner closely with stakeholders to improve and simplify reporting and various processes

        • Perform month-end process, including creating journal entries and working together with the accounting team to ensure accurate results

        • Support reporting and analysis activities, such as: monthly reporting and variance analysis, drive meetings with key stakeholders to explain monthly performance, and help achieve all budget targets

        • Actively manage purchase order requisitions, liaise with purchasing and accounts payable teams to resolve ad-hoc issues/questions from the business

        What do you need to succeed?

        • Experience in budgeting, forecasting and analysis of related activities (expense, revenue or other demand activities) / or project portfolio management experience

        • University degree (Business) and accounting designation (CPA,CMA,CGA) or progress towards the same would be an asset

        • Progressive experience within financial management functions (2-3 years)

        • Motivated individual, capable of owning assignments, displaying initiative, creativity and a willingness to learn and develop

        • Demonstrated analysis and problem solving skills

        • Demonstrated ability to share ideas and contribute to group discussions – building rapport with colleagues to achieve outcomes through influence and partnering

        • Advanced proficiency level and experience with MS Excel is required – demonstrated ability to summarize and distill volumes of data into meaningful reports

        • Previous work experience in Hyperion is desirable

        What’s in it for you?

        • 15 vacation days per year

        • Flexible benefits from the day you join to meet the needs of you and your family

        • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security

        • An environment of continuous learning and improvement

        Work location: this position will provide remote working opportunity following all Covid guidelines; once Sun Life offices re-open, work location is North York/Atria office, or Downtown Toronto.

        The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.

        We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

        Job Description:

        About the Business:

        Sun Life Financial is a leader and innovator in engaging Canadians through digital channels, putting our clients at the center of everything we do. The Sun Life Salesforce Centre of Excellence (CoE) Team is a dynamic group of people, building and supporting exciting mission critical solutions for business areas across Sun Life Canada.  The Salesforce.com platform is a key enabler helping us deliver on our Purpose: To help our Clients achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives.

        About the Role:

                                                                                                 

        The CoE team is growing and looking for an intrapreneurial and business-minded Salesforce Application Designer who can act as a technical Salesforce Subject Matter Expert for complex Salesforce.com implementations. The successful candidate will work closely with business partners and other IT teams to design, develop, and implement Enterprise scale and integrated Salesforce.com solutions.

        Preferred skills:

        • Strong bias for innovation and pursuing creative solutions
        • Self-driven and motivated to get results.
        • Passion, creativity, and collaboration.
        • Embrace change and adept at working collaboratively as part of a cross-functional team to deliver solutions.
        • Strong communication skills (written and verbal) to express ideas, thoughts and questions so that it can be understood by various audiences
        • Strong analysis and problem-solving skills to break down high-level business requirements into more detail by questioning and probing for clarification.
        • Good leadership, planning and consulting skills (business and technical).
        • A strong appreciation of the quickly evolving digital technology landscape and its applicability to businesses and their clients.
        • Self-directed learning

        What you need to succeed:

        • Minimum 6+  years of experience in all aspects of Salesforce.com Lightning development environment including Out Of The Box (OOTB) automation tools, asynchronous and synchronous Apex, Apex Trigger patterns, Visual Force, data migration approach & tools.
        • Minimum 5+ years of experience in integrating Salesforce.com applications with 3rd party system using REST and SOAP web service API. Exposure to event based (publisher and subscriber model) is desirable.
        • Minimum 3+ years of experience leading Enterprise level Salesforce implementations with +1000 users involving integrations with other enterprise applications
        • Must demonstrate hands-on development experience in Lightning Aura and/or LWC framework. Prior experience and/or strong understanding of Lightning LWC framework is a plus.
        • Hands-on experience working with many aspects of the Salesforce platform (Sales Cloud, Experience Cloud, and Financial Services Cloud). Have Completed 1-2 enterprise level Salesforce implementations.
        • Minimum 3+ years of experience with web development technologies like Java, .NET, CSS, JavaScript, HTML, XML and ECMAScript 7 and beyond Javascript standards (Node JS, Bootstrap, Angular etc).
        • 2 years of experience with code management and deployment tools (Salesforce CLI, VSCode, GitHub, BitBucket, JIRA, Jenkins, Force.com Migration Tool, ANT Scripting, etc.). Previous hands-on experience in configuring CI/CD using Salesforce CLI in source structure is a plus.
        • Software development fundamentals such as knowledge of data structures, object oriented programming, relational database design, and design patterns.
        • Hands-on experience with implementing accessibility compliance web design (i.e., AODA Double A compliance).
        • Design and development experience using Agile project methodology.
        • Salesforce Certifications:
          • Must Have: Salesforce Certified Administrator, Salesforce Platform Developer 1

        Responsibilities:

        • Lead the design and development of Salesforce.com solutions, following internal guidelines and standard processes.
        • Evaluate possible design patterns, provide technical recommendation, and estimate for Salesforce solutions that requires minimal customization by taking into account trade-offs between technical feasibility and business value.
        • Be a trusted technical advisor to business partners / sponsors to help define go to market scope and timeline.

        • Provide thought leadership and recommendations for how all aspects of the Salesforce platform can advance Sun Life’s digital transformation.
        • Develop and demonstrate Proof of Concept (PoC) and prototype designs while developing a deep understanding of the business opportunity in order to come up with innovative solutions.
        • Contribute to Salesforce technical governance framework, especially in advancing DevOps practice in Salesforce platform, design and development guideline.
        • Lead post-implementation transition to application operational service team in Sun Life.
        • Maintain and update the necessary system design documentation for applications built in Salesforce platform.

A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. item.title: Director, Par Valuation
item.description:
• Director, Par Valuation

      Waterloo, Ontario
        Sun Life Financial Toronto One York
      Apply

      • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

        Job Description:

        Director, Par Valuation

        Reporting to the AVP, Par & Adjustable Valuation, the successful candidate will work closely with the Associate Director, Par Valuation and Director, Par IFRS17 Lead, and be responsible for leading specific aspects of Participating Insurance Valuation within Insurance Solutions. This includes management of the actuarial valuations, modeling and analysis, as well as various projects for Par products. The successful candidate will also support the transformation of Par valuation for IFRS17 reporting by providing thought leadership on various work streams, especially on the business & financial implications and operational readiness work-streams, in addition to generating data based insights for unlocking potential business value in Par.

        The Participating Insurance business includes an extensive list of insurance products, from four life insurance companies and two demutualization agreements. The business has around $20 billion in actuarial reserves, over $90 billion in gross face amount, and represents the largest par block of business in the company. The Participating Insurance business also accounts for about half of Insurance Solution’s new business premiums.

        What will you do?

        • Manage the production and understanding of results relating to quarterly financial reporting for Par block including reserves, required capital, and source of earnings.

        • Support the transformation of Par business for IFRS 17 reporting by providing thought leadership on specific work streams.

        • Unlock potential business value by developing a deep understanding of the Par business and generating data based insights.

        • Develop, review and recommend changes to valuation and other actuarial models ensuring compliance with the MEUC policy.

        • Provide actuarial expertise and collaborate effectively with key business partners including Corporate, Canadian Actuarial, Pricing, Finance, Audit, ALM, and IT.

        • Provide support for new product/pricing initiatives as well as dividend setting process and implementation.

        • Support production of other key deliverables including management reporting, OSFI reporting, Par CALM Testing, AAR and AAV.

        • Take responsibility for the controls and reconciliations pertaining to integrity of models, reserves and quarterly net income.

        • Help ensure compliance (including signoffs) with the Actuarial Governance Policy and Guidelines, CIA standards of practice, OSFI requirements and any other applicable SLF policies and guidelines.

        What do you need to succeed?

        • FCIA/FSA designation with 5+ years of actuarial experience.

        • Effective leader with the desire to build and manage a diverse & inclusive high performing team.

        • Excellent communication skills.

        • Strong technical, analytical and problem solving skills.

        • Manage multiple priorities with a commitment to high quality and meeting deadlines.

        • Eager to challenge the status quo with a continuous improvement mindset.

        • Dedicated to personal development including the willingness to accept expanding leadership opportunities.

        • Knowledge of insurance products and/or IFRS17 is an asset.

        The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

        Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

        Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

        At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

        We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

item.title: Senior Journey and Service Designer
item.description:
• Senior Journey and Service Designer

      Toronto, Ontario
        Waterloo, Ontario
      Apply

      • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

        Job Description:

        Role Summary 

        Are you a proven Service Designer or Design Strategist who is obsessed with understanding client needs and leading the design of experiences to delight them? 

        Reporting to the Director, Client Journey Owner, in the Canadian Client Experience Office (CXO), the Senior Journey & Service Designer is responsible for taking a client centric view to reimagine journeys to help our clients achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives.  

        In this role, you will drive the service design for a portfolio of client journeys to produce measurable business and client impact. You will work closely with partners from across the business to identify opportunities, explore concepts and co-create expectational experiences. You will apply service design tools to create a comprehensive view of future state experiences by connecting client facing digital/ non-digital touchpoints with back-end capabilities to support development and delivery phases. 

        What will you do? 

        • Design end-to-end, integrated omni-channel experiences for our clients based on a deep understanding of client behaviours, business strategy and operating models.   

        • Lead the exploration, definition and design for your portfolio by leveraging innovative design methodologies to produce service design deliverables including competitive scans, service blueprints, future state journey maps, storyboards, concepts, iterative prototypes and user testing. 

        • Partner closely with colleagues across business strategy, UX, product development and technology to support discovery activities and co-create future state experiences to inform delivery roadmap.  

        • Translate complex systems and challenges into compelling narratives to engage key stakeholders and challenge status quo. 

        • Support the Director, Client Journey Owner and key partners to help define the Canada CX Strategy and prioritized client journeys 

        What do you need to succeed? 

        • 5+ years experience in service design, CX strategy, product strategy or a closely related field  

        • Post-secondary education in a related field 

        • Command of design methodology in working through complex ambiguous challenges  

        • Comfortable in critically assessing systems and processes to effectively challenge current state operating models  

        • Expertise in analyzing and synthesizing qualitative and quantitative data from multiple sources to form a holistic understanding of a problem space. 

        • Demonstrated ability to present compelling arguments for change 

        • Facilitation skills to lead a range of workshops and ideation sessions to co-create with business partners and end-users.  

        • Familiarity with emerging technology and how it can be applied to elevate client experiences  

        • Strong collaboration skills to establish partnerships with key business unit stakeholders 

        • Strong visual communicator with the ability to produce artifacts at different levels, such as system maps, storyboards, and UX prototypes. 

        • Background in financial services is an asset 

        Additional Requirement 

        Please note that selected candidates will be required to share a portfolio of work that demonstrates your approach, and how it has led to transformational changes related to client experience. 

        What’s in it for you? 

        • Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data 

        • 20 days vacation per year and an innovative sabbatical program 

        • A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture 

        • Flexible Benefits from the day you join to meet the needs of you and your family 

        • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security 

        • Fitness and wellness programs that help you balance work and life and enjoy a healthier lifestyle 

        The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

        Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

        Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

        At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

        We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

        67,400/67 400 - 110,100/110 100

        Job Category:

        Business Analysis - Process

• Mainframe Developer

      Waterloo, Ontario
        Sun Life Financial Toronto Atria
      Apply

      • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights.         Job Description:

        PL/1 development language is a requirement of the role

        Do you enjoy the challenges and variety of work that an application support team can offer? Do you enjoy collaborating with a strong, technical team?  Do you want to expand your mainframe skills working with some of the best mainframe developer’s at Sun Life? Here’s your chance! The Individual Application Operations and Services (AOS) team is looking for a Mainframe Developer to join our team.  Check out the details below and apply today if you feel this aligns with your skills and career goals.

        About the business:

        Application Operations Services (AOS) is a team of skilled professionals who are dedicated to ensuring reliability of applications for our business partners to help clients achieve lifetime financial security. We focus on improving our business partner’s experience by maintaining a stable environment. We are looking for a skilled PL/I Mainframe Developer to work with the AOS Individual team providing application support. The successful candidate is a highly motivated individual with have strong analytical skills and a continuous improvement mindset.   

        What will you do?

        • Provide ongoing support of mainframe technologies including responding to service requests, problem analysis, resolution, escalation and reporting as necessary
        • Identify and participate in improvement, system renewal, stability, and upgrade projects
        • As part of a support team, interface with developers, infrastructure teams, system designers, business system analysts, application analysts and testing specialists to deliver high quality solutions and maintain a stable environment
        • Participate in various review processes (e.g. Design reviews, and Transitions to Support) to gain a solid understanding of the application and provide input into the various deliverables from a support perspective
        • Provide coaching to development team and peers on tools, techniques, and processes
        • Keep current with trends in emerging technologies and how they could apply to Sun Life
        • Occasional weekend work in support of project implementations
        • Participation in an on-call rotation will be required

        What you need to succeed:

        • 5+ years of experience PL/1 development language 
        • University degree or Diploma in Computer Science or technology
        • 3+ years of experience IMS and DB2 databases
        • 3+ years of experience with DevOps Environment tools an asset
        • IBM OS/390 mainframe an asset

        Preferred skills:

        • Excellent problem analysis and troubleshooting skills
        • Strong leadership, planning, organizational and consulting skills
        • Self-driven and motivated to get results.
        • Ability to communicate effectively to technical and non-technical audiences
        • Strong coaching and mentoring skills

        • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security
        • An environment of continuous learning and improvement
        • Flexible hours and periodic work from home options

item.title: GRS Application Developer II
item.description:
• GRS Application Developer II

      Waterloo, Ontario
    Apply

    • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

      Job Description:

      Group Retirement Services (GRS) is Canada\'s leading provider of defined contribution retirement savings plans, helping 1.2 million Canadians preparing for, and in retirement.

      Being an industry leader and helping millions of Canadians with their savings and retirement goals is a profound responsibility. We acknowledge that responsibility with respect, confidence and passion – and we are looking for a high performing and talented individual to help us remain competitive.

      What will you do? ​

      • Support all GRS clients on complex situations, corrections, plan implementations and special projects
      • Provide coaching to other team members on processes for which they have expertise
      • Partner with business and technology areas to fully understand their needs, consult and work with them to deliver appropriate quality solutions and services in a timely and efficient manner
      • Ensure that solutions, while meeting development standards, meet both business requirements and technical requirements, including performance, maintainability and stability
      • Design solutions which satisfy business requirements
      • Ensure the application performs within established SLA\'s
      • Assist to ensure projects are delivered on schedule, within budget, meet requirements, and satisfy Sun Life Financial quality standards
      • Identify and assist in the re-engineering, improvement or replacement of business processes and associated technologies
      • Work closely with other team members and be in contact with our business partners as required
      • Have an opportunity to work with an offshore team, SLF internal and third party vendors

      *This role includes occasional over time

      ​What do you need to succeed?

      • Ability to work with clients to understand and act based on their needs
      • Teamwork - ability to work collaboratively with others (technical and non-technical partners or team members)
      • Strong communication skills  (written and verbal) - ability to express ideas, thoughts and information so that it can be understood by various audiences and meets the client needs
      • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
      • Self-motivated and service-oriented, a self-starter
      • Good organizational and time management skills
      • Multi-tasker, has positive energy and attitude to work in a fast-paced, dynamic team environment
      • Expert level knowledge of Excel, with knowledge of VBA programming with integrated userforms
      • Knowledge of standardized data structures and algorithm design
      • ​University education or equivalent
      • Experience in performing global Gap Analysis
      • Mainframe knowledge would be an asset
      • Strong knowledge of our Global record keeping system
      • In-depth knowledge of group retirement products (GRS), processes, services, investments, and tools
      • Ability to build and maintain macros and technical documentation relating to those
      • Knowledge of Access database development and management
      • Knowledge of VBScript or Windows scripting

      What’s in it for you?

      • The opportunity to move along a variety of career paths with amazing networking potential
      • A collaborative and interactive team environment
      • Joining a reputable organization with over 150 years of history

      The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.

We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

      Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

      We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
