item.title: Senior Software Engineer
item.description:
As an employee at Thomson Reuters, you will play a role in shaping and leading the global knowledge economy. Our technology drives global markets and helps professionals around the world make decisions that matter.  Whether solving for today’s challenges or tomorrow’s aspirations, you will work with the industry’s brightest thinkers on diverse projects, creating next-generation solutions that deliver powerful results.   As the world’s leading provider of intelligent information, we want your unique perspective to create the solutions that advance our business—and your career.

Are you intrigued by the opportunity to shape the quality and consistency of code for data ingestion and processing applications across cloud providers? Do you love clean code? If so, we would love to hear from you and discuss how you could help Thomson Reuters and the Data Engine team build solutions to complex data problems for Thomson Reuters. The Data Engine team provides solutions serving large global customers through Thomson Reuters ONESOURCE Platform suite of applications. Data Engine is a part of the Technology – Product Engineering organization and operates in the Corporate Tax & Trade segment. We are excited to interview candidates for a Senior Software Engineer vacancy in our Toronto head office.

As a Senior Software Engineer you will be expected to provide clean, quality code in the language most appropriate for the task at hand whether building RESTful APIs or data pipelines. Our Senior Software Engineers provide guidance and assist with continuous improvement of fellow developers through collaboration, grooming and code reviews as required. You will be comfortable defending your opinions and willing to provide direction on implementation choices.

About the Role

As a Senior Software Engineer, you will: 

  • Build and Develop – software applications by understanding user needs, writing well designed code, conducting validation/testing and executing full SDLC from design through release

  • Be a Team Player – work in a collaborative team-oriented environment, share information, value diverse ideas, partner with cross functional and remote teams; Experience working with cross functional and remote teams

  • Be Curious & Innovative – continuously update yourself with next generation technology, development tools, and contribute to process development practices

  • Be an Agile Person – with strong sense of urgency and a desire to work in a fast-paced dynamic environment to deliver solutions against strict timelines

  • Be an Effective Communicator – articulate complex technical issues, and share ideas, participate in peer-reviews, and exhibit strong listening skills

  • Take Ownership – responsible for performance, reliability and implement changes for improving efficiency of a technical component

About You

You’re a fit for the role of Senior Software Engineer if you have:

Basic qualifications:

  • 5+ years experience coding in OOP (Java/Python), software engineering and development process 

  • Experience working with cloud native applications (GCP, AWS, Azure), understanding of design patterns for scalability, performance and reliability

  • Experience building API services using either or all: REST, SOAP, XML-RPC, JSON-RPC

  • Experience with Agile/Scrum development methodologies to deliver high end applications against strict timelines, have strong understanding of agile principles

  • Experience with test-driven development and automated testing frameworks

Preferred qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science or equivalent experience  

  • Interest or experience coaching junior and mid-level engineers

  • Strong DevOps focus, and experience with technologies like Docker, Chef, Kubernetes etc.

  • Familiarity of front-end technology such as React or Angular

What’s in it For You

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

  • Learning & Development:

    • Exposure to a wide breadth of leading-edge technology

    • Career growth - ability to work on multiple projects and/or with various teams

    • Professional growth and development opportunity through various training programs, conferences, networking events, in-house speaker series etc.

    • Access to Hackathons, Unconferences, Harvard Manage Mentor and more, we offer learning opportunities for everyone

  • Benefits/Perks: 

    • Health benefits

    • Savings/investment plans

    • Paid time off (including time off to volunteer and extended parental leave)

  • Flexibility: We\'ve been named as one of Forbes, Best Companies for Work/Life Balance

  • Global Opportunities:  We have employees in over 90 countries, working across 3 different industries

  • Your wellbeing:  We offer a program that focuses on making our lives healthier

Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

item.title: Solution Architect - Marketing
item.description:
Solution Architect – Marketing

Do you want to help one of the most respected companies in the world reinvent its approach to Marketing Technology? Are you a strategic thinker with a strong background in solution architecture?  We are looking for you to join our team as a Solution Architect – Marketing. We are recruiting a team of motivated technology professionals to transform how we manage and leverage technology solutions to enable our go to market strategies. This is a unique opportunity for you to join a diverse and global team with centers of excellence in Toronto, Minneapolis and Dallas.

As a Marketing Solution Architect you will be responsible for the conceptual and logical solution architecture of the Marketing technology ecosystem. You will also collaborate with key stakeholders to define the marketing technology architecture roadmap and support the selection and implementation of technologies, including tooling, integration patterns and data interoperability to allow us to seamlessly operate world class marketing.

About the Role

In this opportunity as a Marketing Solution Architect, you will: 

Design: Understanding business strategy and supporting processes to drive the right architecture, leading to an integrated systems architecture

Recommend new or different technologies that will not only meet project requirements, but also align to business objectives, roadmaps and strategic solutions, as well as to TR’s architecture principles and standards

Deliver: Clear architecture documents, including architecture patterns, decisions, and rationale for those decisions

Mentor/Lead: Act as counselor to business counterparts, customers, and management on requirements and capabilities pertinent to Marketing Technology

Be a Team Player: Working in a collaborative team-oriented environment, you will share information, value diverse ideas, partner with cross functional and remote teams

Be an Agile Person:  with strong sense of urgency and a desire to work in a fast-paced dynamic environment, you will deliver solutions against strict timelines

Be Innovative: you are empowered to try new approaches and learn new technologies. Have a desire to learn and embrace new and emerging technology.

Be an Effective Communicator: Present and communicate the solution architecture to various stakeholders, both technical and business, and be able to explain how the solution design will meet business needs

About You

You’re a fit for the role of Marketing Solution Architect if you:

Hands-on experience with marketing technologies including some of the following:

  • Marketing Automation Platform (Eloqua)

  • Digital Marketing technologies – Account based marketing, Content management (Adobe, 6Sense)

  • Operational tools - Planning & budgeting, Workflow management (Hive9, Workfront)

  • Data – Customer Data Platform, Data Management Platform, Preference management (D&B Lattice, Adobe)

  • Orchestration – Application integration, APIs

  • CRM tools – Platforms supporting Sales & Service (Salesforce.com)

  • Virtual event management

  • Industry knowledge of leading marketing and marketing technology trends, prior experience in an enterprise marketing organization

  • Experience working in teams who have designed and implemented marketing technology solutions

  • Skilled in all aspects of system design including tools capability, integration design, data modeling, security & privacy, business process implementation, etc.

  • Have a solid understanding of delivery methodology to help ensure solutions are implemented according to the design/architecture

  • TOGAF certification preferred

  • Bachelor\'s Degree (or equivalent) in Computer Science, IT, related technical field or equivalent work experience.

What’s in it For You

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

  • Learning & Development:

    • Exposure to a wide breadth of leading-edge technology

    • Career growth - ability to work on multiple projects and/or with various teams

    • Professional growth and development opportunity through various training programs, conferences, networking events, in-house speaker series etc.

    • Access to Hackathons, Unconferences, Harvard Manage Mentor and more, we offer learning opportunities for everyone

    • Paid time off (including time off to volunteer and extended parental leave)

  • Global Opportunities:  We have employees in over 90 countries, working across 3 different industries

item.title: Lead, Machine Learning Software Engineer
item.description:
Come and join the Global Digital Technology team at one of the most respected companies globally, as we work to transform Thomson Reuters into a truly Digital company. We aren\'t just changing how customers engage with us but also transforming and re-imagining our business by focusing on the individual user. We are looking for an experienced Lead Software Engineer with experience in Machine Learning techniques and building data-driven capabilities that drive personalized digital customer experiences. Our team promotes an agile, collaborative, supportive environment where diverse thinking, innovative design and experimentation are welcomed and encouraged. Our work focuses on an extensive portfolio of transformational efforts as we work together to deliver on the promise of making it easy to do business with Thomson Reuters.

About The Role

In this opportunity, you will:

  • Develop, Deliver & Lead: build and deliver ML models that power personalized digital experiences and customized Thomson Reuters\' web content, product bundling, services offering, as well as add-ons. 

  • Be a Team Player: Working in a diverse and collaborative team-oriented environment, you will share information, value diverse ideas, partner with cross-functional and remote teams. This role will partner closely with the digital front and back-end engineering teams and the digital product management function to deliver seamless and intuitive digital solutions to our global customers.

  • Be an Agile Person:  with a strong sense of urgency and a desire to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, you will deliver innovative solutions using modern technologies. 

  • Be Innovative: you are empowered to try new approaches and learn new technologies. You will contribute creative ideas, create solutions, and be accountable for end-to-end deliveries. 

  • Be an Effective Communicator: through active engagement and communication with cross-functional partners and team members, you will effectively articulate ideas and collaborate on technical developments. 

About You 

You\'re a fit for the role if you have: 

  • 7+ years of experience building ML systems with the demonstrated ability to translate cutting edge research into working applications

  • A solid understanding of the SDLC and hands-on experience in one or more programming and scripting languages (Python, Java, TypeScript, JavaScript, etc.) as well as familiarity with SQL

  • A solid understanding of concepts in machine learning and statistics, including recommendation models

  • Ability to understand, apply, integrate and deploy Machine Learning capabilities and techniques into other systems. 

  • Familiarity with the Python data science stack through exposure to libraries such as Numpy, Scipy, Pandas, Dask, spaCy, NLTK, sci-kit learn. 

  • Experience writing clean, reusable, maintainable and well-tested code.

  • Demonstrated proficiency in automation, system monitoring, and cloud-native applications, with familiarity in AWS or Azure (or a related cloud platform) 

  • A desire to learn and embrace new and emerging technology 

  • A Bachelor\'s Degree (or equivalent) in Computer Science, Computer/Software Engineering or related technical field. 

We\'d also strongly value if you: 

  • Had previous exposure to commercial recommendation (or following best action) engines based on propensity models

  • Can understand and translate between language and methodologies used both in research and engineering fields 

  • Have been successfully taking and integrating Machine Learning solutions to production-grade software

What\'s in it for you  

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. In addition to rewarding and challenging work with exceptional colleagues, we offer the following benefits for your personal and professional growth: 

  • Learning & Development: On-the-job coaching & learning, tuition reimbursement, exposure to leading-edge technology 

  • Our Scientists and Engineers get to play with big data sets to discover new products, capabilities, and insights for our customers. Thomson Reuters is most well-known for the globally respected Reuters News agency, but our company is also the leading source of information for legal, corporate and tax professionals. We have over 60,000 TBs worth of legal, regulatory, news, and tax data.  

  • Benefits: Flexible work arrangements, comprehensive health coverage effective day one, savings and investment plans 

  • Perks: Social events & activities, employee discount programs 

  • Social Impact: Paid time off for volunteering virtually or in your community

item.title: Sr. User Experience Researcher
item.description:
Sr. User Experience Researcher
Thomson Reuters is looking for a Senior User Experience Researcher to help deliver a user experience that is intuitive, comfortable, and that will develop trust for this state-of-the-art technology. As a Senior UX Researcher, you will define and execute on user research programs, spanning a broad set of experiences and modalities. Research activities will predominantly be discovery to develop a deeper understanding of users that will inform an intuitive and satisfying product design, along with some evaluative work (usability studies and concept evaluation).

Your UX research will be essential in our ongoing effort to better enable product and design teams to make informed, confident decisions. The ideal candidate will be comfortable with a high degree of ambiguity.
 

About the Role:

In this role as Sr. User Experience Researcher, you will

  • Determine and recommend the most efficient and effective user-centered research approaches (qualitative and quantitative) to solve for business needs, meet agreed-upon objectives, and guide business areas through the appropriate UX process.
  • Lead foundational research activities that explore the problem space, frame the problems to be solved, and gather enough evidence and initial direction to define what to do next.
  • Lead discovery research activities to inform UX design decisions.
  • Monitor UX project execution, including establishing and tracking UX project metrics and UX product scorecards.
  • Develop user journeys and personas.
  • Synthesize quantitative data with qualitative data to help drive product and design decisions.
  • Work collaboratively with user experience team members, content writers, development teams, product teams, users, and other stakeholders as part of an agile software development process.
  • Support, partner and influence multi-disciplinary teams, including other business areas, to execute UX projects.
  • Take ownership for self-development, stay current with research techniques and tools in the field of UX.
  • Be a self-starter. Take initiatives and drive projects from beginning to end.
  • Mentor and assist UX Researchers as needed.

About You:

You are a fit for the role of Sr. User Experience Researcher, If you have:

  • Master’s degree or higher in a field such as Cognitive Psychology, Human-Computer Interaction, User Experience, Human Factors, Engineering Psychology, Interactive Design, or equivalent.
  • 5+ years of UX research experience or 8+ years of experience in lieu of degree.
  • Experience in UX research on B2B SaaS solutions.
  • Experience in foundational/generative and qualitative research to identify needs/problems and workflow/task analysis.
  • Experience conducting qualitative and quantitative research throughout an Agile development process.
  • Experience with using data analytics to identify UX research course of action a plus.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Comfortable with planning, prioritizing, conducting, analyzing and communicating research in a variety of contexts.
  • A dedicated advocate of a user-centered, evidence-based approach to product development, while balancing business needs.
  • Excellent verbal/written communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate effectively with all stakeholders, customers, and team members.

This position can be located in Toronto, London, Zug, Minneapolis, Dallas

 

What’s in it For You:

At Thomson Reuters, people are our greatest assets & in this role you will be part of Thomson Reuters Product Organisation which is comprised of the most experienced personnel in the industry & supported by Executive Management team. There are exciting changes happening in UX Research team at Thomson Reuters and our team is growing! We are looking for a senior-level researcher to join our team at Thomson Reuters to assist in improving the experience of our software and discovering new opportunities for innovation in product development. As a Senior UX Researcher , you will be working within a cross-functional team, defining and executing on user research programs, spanning a broad set of experiences and modalities. Research activities will predominantly be discovery to develop a deeper understanding of users that will inform an intuitive and satisfying product design, along with some evaluative work (usability studies and concept evaluation). Experience in generative research, storytelling and presentation skills are a must.

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Excel Solutions
item.description:
Are you a multi-dimensional developer? Do you know Microsoft Excel, web services, modern APIs, with a hint of legacy systems knowledge? If so, the ONESOURCE Dataflow team at Thomson Reuters is looking to add someone like you. Join the ONESOURCE Dataflow team. A tight, hard-working, geographically diverse team that prides itself in the delivery of one of the most popular data collection platforms. We specialize in the collection of a wide variety of data to support multitudes of business processes. We collaborate with multiple business segments building integrations and providing key solutions for clients both internal and external. 

About the Role 

As a Sr. Software Engineer, you will: 

  • Build and Develop – software applications by understanding user needs, writing well-designed code, conducting validation/testing, and executing full SDLC from design through release 

  • Be a Team Player – work in a collaborative team-oriented environment, share information, value diverse ideas, partner with cross-functional and remote teams

  • Be Curious & Innovative – continuously update yourself with next-generation technology, development tools, and contribute to process development practices

  • Be an Agile Person – with a strong sense of urgency and a desire to work in a fast-paced dynamic environment to deliver solutions against strict timelines

  • Be an Effective Communicator – articulate complex technical issues, and share ideas, participate in peer reviews, and exhibit strong listening skills

  • Take Ownership – responsible for performance, reliability and implement changes for improving the efficiency of a technical component 

About You

You’re a fit for the role of Sr. Software Engineer if you have: 

  • Hands-on proven experience with developing Add-Ins for Microsoft Excel in C# and VBA.

  • Hands on proven experience, or ability to learn, developing applications to interact with spreadsheets using a variety of 3rd party spreadsheet components.

  • Hands-on experience coding in OOP (C#), software engineering, and development process  

  • Experience with Agile/Scrum development methodologies to deliver high-end applications against strict timelines, have a strong understanding of agile principles

  • Experience building and interacting with API services using either or all: REST

  • Experience working with cross-functional and remote teams

  • Experience with test-driven development and automated testing frameworks

  • Eager to learn and willing to take initiatives

Preferred qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science or equivalent experience   

  • Interest or experience coaching junior and mid-level engineers

  • Experience working with cloud-native applications (AWS, Azure, Google), understanding of design patterns for scalability, performance, and reliability.

  • In-depth familiarity with Microsoft Office automation and development.

  • Basic familiarity with front-end technology such as React or Angular.

  • Familiarity with writing console and windows applications/utilities.

What’s in it For You?

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

  • COVID-19 Response: Currently working remotely and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines with the majority of our offices being remote until August 2021. Upon return, we will be embracing a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work

  • Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more

  • Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing

  • Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking

  • Social Impact: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact

item.title: Senior Software Engineer
item.description:
Thomson Reuters Indirect Tax Group is responsible for a suite of highly available, mission-critical products, which enable our large scale global customers to compute tax for every transaction that flows through their systems worldwide. The transactions ranged from online transactions generated from travel sites, e-commerce sites; transactions at points of sale for retail customers; transactions between participating businesses across 190 countries worldwide.

Are you passionate about building large, scalable, highly available, 24 / 7 mission-critical systems deployed in the cloud? If so, join us at our Toronto Technology Centre, and help shape the product\'s future and take it to new heights.

About the Role 

As a Senior Software Engineer, you will: 

  • Build and Develop – 

    • Software applications by understanding user needs, functional and non-functional requirements; writing well designed, performant, testable and extensible code, employing the most appropriate design patterns, data structures, algorithms; ensuring adherence to all aspects of SDLC including static code analysis, testing, security scans, all the way through deployment into production

    • Software applications with a constant /continuous focus on cross-cutting concerns like but not limited to reliability, resilience, scalability, performance, security and alignment with the big picture of the overall application

    • Troubleshoot and debug issues and production incidents

  • Be a Team Player – 

    • Work in a collaborative team-oriented environment, share information, value diverse ideas, partner with cross-functional and remote teams

    • Mentoring junior engineers, helping them understand the product and encouraging them to adopt and apply best practices of design and development

    • Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback

  • Be Curious & Innovative – 

    • Continuously update yourself with next-generation technology, development tools, and apply the same towards improvement in the product and development practices

  • Be an Agile Person – with a strong sense of urgency and a desire to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment to deliver solutions against strict timelines.

  • Be an Effective Communicator – articulate complex technical issues, and share ideas, participate in peer-reviews, and exhibit strong listening skills

  • Take Ownership – responsible for performance, reliability and implement changes for improving the efficiency of a technical component. 

About You

You\'re a fit for the role of Senior Software Engineer if you have: 

Basic qualifications:

  • Strong Computer Science fundamentals in Data Structures and algorithm design. Strong understanding of time and space complexity.

  • Hands-on experience coding in OOP (JAVA, Springboot, spring framework), software engineering and development process  

  • Experience with relational database systems, e.g. Oracle, PostgreSQL and ORM tools like Hibernate and JPA framework.

  • Experience working with cloud-native applications (AWS), understanding design patterns for scalability, performance and reliability.

  • Experience building API services using: REST, SOAP, deployed in a distributed environment, and a good understanding of related concepts like distributed caching, strong and eventual

  • Experience with Agile/Scrum development methodologies to deliver high-end applications against strict timelines have a strong understanding of agile principles.

  • Experience working with cross-functional and remote teams

Preferred qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree in computer science or equivalent experience   

  • Strong DevOps focus and experience with technologies like Docker, Chef, Kubernetes etc.

What\'s in it For You

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

  • Learning & Development: 

    • Exposure to a wide breadth of leading-edge technology

    • Career growth - the ability to work on multiple projects and/or with various teams

    • Professional growth and development opportunity through various training programs, conferences, networking events, in-house speaker series etc.

    • Access to Hackathons, Unconferences, Harvard Manage Mentor and more, we offer learning opportunities for everyone

  • Benefits/Perks: 

    • Health benefits

    • Savings/investment plans

    • Paid time off (including time off to volunteer and extended parental leave)

  • Flexibility: We\'ve been named as one of Forbes, Best Companies for Work/Life Balance

  • Global Opportunities:  We have employees in over 90 countries, working across 3 different industries

  • Your wellbeing:  We offer a program that focuses on making our lives healthier

item.title: Cloud Security Associate Architect
item.description:
Essential Responsibilities:

  • Maintain a deep understanding of core public cloud security disciplines, with close attention to developing industry trends in the context of networking, identity, and platform security technologies
  • Serve as the Cloud Security Lead in the design, implementation, and integration phases of business products and services to meet business security requirements, address corporate risks and exposures in cloud-based solutions
  • Maintain a deep understanding of capabilities and patterns to controlling access to the public cloud through authentication, authorization, access policy, and secrets management
  • Collaborate with business and technology peers to understand business goals, use cases for cloud-native deployments or lift-and-shift
  • Thoroughly interact with DevOps, platform engineering team, Network security engineers, and Identity build and run teams. Should be able to guide the teams to drive results and maturity
  • Perform threat modeling on the cloud-based scenarios and able to apply the principles to secure the cloud platforms
  • Drive security design principles and requirements to enhance ISRMs ability to streamline the implementation of security controls into new and existing solutions
  • Should be able to enforce the security principles in live scenarios by working closing with landing zone teams
  • Serve as a cloud security subject matter expert during discussions and meetings with key stakeholders within the business unit and infrastructure teams
  • Interact with peers, project teams, technical specialists, and other senior members of the company to provide advice on cloud security and identity-related security. Provide technical security expertise, including communicating security architectural decisions, benefits, risks, and other activities including security requirement definition, and facilitation of security testing and management of residual risk with the product or application teams
  • Develop and maintain security frameworks, consisting of appropriate controls from NIST CSF, PCI-DSS, HIPAA, and other relevant industry documentation

Key Relationships: (Those key individuals they will work with internally and externally)

Cloud Architects, Datacenter Architects, Business Unit Architects and Back Office Architects

Essential Skills/Experience Required: (Outline in bullet point form the absolute must-have skills & experience)

Qualifications/Requirements 

5+ Years experience in a security-related domain and technologies

3+ Years experience in security architecture space

2+ Years of Hands-On experience in the cloud security platforms such as AWS, Azure or Google (preferably engineering)

Working and hands-on knowledge of:

  • Hands-on capability on Cloud platforms and migrating workloads from Data Center to Cloud Platforms
  • Should be conversant with most of the Cloud Platform Security domains
  • Should have good knowledge of security containers and hands-on experience on SecDevOps principles and has a good handle on end-to-end Sec Dev Ops processes.
  • Good understanding of Key Management, Secrets Handling, knowledge on the tools which provide services like Single Sign-On, MFA, enabling data security principles in the cloud platforms. etc
  • Technology and hands-on exposure to Active Directory, Palo Alto Prisma, Advanced firewalls, virtual directory services, etc  

About You

Education/ Certifications: (Specific degrees and/or certifications (denote required or preferred))

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field required
  • Certification like AWS Security Specialty, Google Cloud Platform Engineer with focus on security, Azure Security, etc are preferred  
  • Technical understanding of cloud-native architecture and engineering best practices
  • CISSP or equivalent  certification are preferred

item.title: Senior Software Engineer
item.description:
As an employee at Thomson Reuters, you will play a role in shaping and leading the global knowledge economy. Our technology drives global markets and helps professionals around the world make decisions that matter.  Whether solving for today’s challenges or tomorrow’s aspirations, you will work with the industry’s brightest thinkers on diverse projects, creating next-generation solutions that deliver powerful results.   As the world’s leading provider of intelligent information, we want your unique perspective to create the solutions that advance our business—and your career.

Thomson Reuters is seeking a passionate, hardworking, and enthusiastic Senior Software Engineer to be part of our highly dynamic engineering team responsible for the development and modernization of our ONESOURCE Global Trade application suite. ONESOURCE Global Trade is a comprehensive trade automation solution designed to help multinational corporations increase efficiency, reduce costs, manage risk, and seamlessly meet import/export compliance regulations around the world.

About the Role

As a Senior Software Engineer, you will: 

  • Develop and modernize – software applications using best practices in coordination with a distributed team

  • Be a Team Player and contributor – work in a collaborative team-oriented environment, share information, value diverse ideas, partner with cross-functional and remote teams; contribute to design choices where necessary

  • Be Curious & Innovative – have an advanced understanding of software development methodologies and the demonstrated ability to design and develop complex software systems; leverage “innovation time” to work on pet projects and special areas of interest; comfortable with ambiguity, and even use it to drive better ideas, work and success

  • Be an Agile Person – contribute to all aspects of an agile software development process including design, programming, testing, documentation, quality assurance, and implementation

  • Be an Effective Communicator – articulate complex technical issues, and share ideas, participate in peer reviews, and exhibit strong listening skills

  • Take Ownership – lead code reviews to enforce code standards and provide constructive feedback to developers; strong debugging, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills

  • Be a Leader – mentor the technical resources on the team to reinforce best practice and develop the team members

About You

You’re a fit for the role of Senior Software Engineer if you have:

Basic qualifications:

  • 5 to 7 years of experience developing cloud-native applications using C#, .NET core, MVC, Microservices, API\'s, Angular, Typescript and Databases

  • Experience with AWS - Serverless / Lambda, Containers - Docker, ECS/EKS & Kubernetes, Message Queueing Services – Amazon SQS / MQ

  • SaaS-based software development experience on large to enterprise-class applications

Preferred qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science or equivalent experience  

  • Understand algorithms and data structure and how to efficiently implement them into a solution

  • Ability to translate business requirements into analytics solutions and create visualizations levering data modeling tools

  • Have a vision for product modernization through innovation and cutting-edge technology

  • Experience with Domain-Driven Design (DDD) software development practices

  • Understanding of design patterns and N-Tier architecture

  • Understanding of DevOps - CI/CD pipeline and tools

What’s in it For You

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

  • Learning & Development:

    • Exposure to a wide breadth of leading-edge technology

    • Career growth - ability to work on multiple projects and/or with various teams

    • Professional growth and development opportunity through various training programs, conferences, networking events, in-house speaker series etc.

    • Access to Hackathons, Unconferences, Harvard Manage Mentor , and more, we offer learning opportunities for everyone

  • Benefits/Perks: 

    • Health benefits

    • Savings/investment plans

    • Paid time off (including time off to volunteer and extended parental leave)

  • Flexibility: We\'ve been named as one of Forbes, Best Companies for Work/Life Balance

  • Global Opportunities:  We have employees in over 90 countries, working across 3 different industries

  • Your wellbeing:  We offer a program that focuses on making our lives healthier

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

item.title: Microsoft 365 Solution Architect
item.description:
Microsoft 365 Solution Architect

Do you want to help one of the most respected companies in the world to provide the best in class employee experience? Are you a strategic thinker with a strong background in solution architecture? At Thomson Reuters, we are recruiting a motivated technology professional to help transform how we manage and leverage technology solutions to simplify and support our employee experience strategy.

As a Microsoft 365 Solution Architect, you will work with internal Microsoft 365 platform service owners to support and continually improve the employee experience (EX) at Thomson Reuters. You will possess and maintain expertise in the platform. Utilizing that knowledge, you will develop innovative and cost-effective solutions, inspire, and inform internal customers and coworkers. You will also collaborate with key stakeholders to define the EX architecture roadmap, support the selection and implementation of technologies, including tooling, integration patterns, and data interoperability across TR business systems.

This is a unique opportunity to join a diverse and global team with locations in Toronto, Minneapolis, and Dallas.

About the Role

In this opportunity as a Microsoft 365 Solution Architect, you will: 

  • Design: Understanding business strategy and supporting processes to drive the right architecture, leading to an integrated systems architecture

  • Recommend new or different technologies that will not only meet project requirements, but also align to business objectives, roadmaps and strategic solutions, as well as to TR’s architecture principles and standards

  • Deliver: Create architecture documents, including architecture patterns, decisions, and rationale for those decisions

  • Mentor: Act as counselor to business counterparts, customers, and management on requirements and capabilities pertinent to Employee Experience as relates to your area of expertise.

  • Lead: Business facing skills with the ability to collaborate to solve needs and manage scope in a positive way

  • Be a Team Player: Working in a collaborative team-oriented environment, you will share information, value diverse ideas, partner with cross functional and remote teams

  • Be an Agile Person:  with strong sense of urgency and a desire to work in a fast-paced dynamic environment, you will deliver solutions against strict timelines

  • Be Innovative: you are empowered to try new approaches and learn new technologies. Have a desire to learn and embrace new and emerging technology.

  • Be an Effective Communicator: Present and communicate the solution architecture to various stakeholders, both technical and business, and be able to explain how the solution design will meet business needs

About You

You’re a fit for the role of Microsoft 365 Solution Architect if you:

  • Have hands-on experience with Microsoft 365, and specifically:

  • Exchange online, SharePoint online, Microsoft Teams (and its voice and video capabilities), Yammer, and Power Platform (PowerBI, Power Automate, Power Apps)

  • You understand administrative, security, and data loss prevention capabilities of Microsoft 365

  • You have experience with Azure AD, and Azure AD Connect.

  • Enjoy working collaboratively with internal stakeholders to maximize M365 functionality and user experience

  • Able to stay current on M365 features and capabilities including availability, reliability, performance, monitoring, backup, and security

  • Able to lead technical discussions with internal customers that drive decisions and implementation

  • Have an ability to visualize, articulate, and solve complex problems

  • Have high standard of organizational skills and strong attention to detail

  • Able to participates in compliance and security reviews as necessary 

  • You’re skilled in all aspects of system design including tools capability, integration design, data modeling, security & privacy, business process implementation, etc.

  • Have a solid understanding of delivery methodology to help ensure solutions are implemented according to the design/architecture

  • Have experience with TOGAF

  • Have a Bachelor\'s Degree (or equivalent) in Computer Science, IT, related technical field or equivalent work experience.

What’s in it For You

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

  • Learning & Development:

    • Exposure to a wide breadth of leading-edge technology

    • Career growth - ability to work on multiple projects and/or with various teams

    • Professional growth and development opportunity through various training programs, conferences, networking events, in-house speaker series etc.

    • Access to Hackathons, Unconferences, Harvard Manage Mentor and more, we offer learning opportunities for everyone

  • Benefits/Perks: 

    • Health benefits

    • Savings/investment plans

    • Paid time off (including time off to volunteer and extended parental leave)

item.title: Senior AEM Engineer - React
item.description:
Thomson Reuters is at the leading edge of a rapidly changing relationship between information, analysis, and the business decision-making process. We are integrating technological advances like Artificial Intelligence into our flagship products and developing new advances to technologies.

The Digital Experience Platforms group at Thomson Reuters is hiring for a Senior Web Engineer with Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) platform expertise - Responsible for designing, building & maintaining best in class modern web experiences leveraging the Digital Web Content Management paradigm\'s best practices.

About the Role

In this opportunity as Senior AEM Engineer, you will:

  • Be a Technical Leader: Effectively contribute to Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) enterprise-level ecosystem in development, technical oversight, and enterprise systems integrations. Design and develop technical approaches and solutions and provide recommendations on building effectively on the AEM platform. Provide technical oversight to the development team around analysis, development, and unit testing of modules & artifacts developed on AEM leveraging modern web development.

  • Be an efficient Stakeholder Manager: Collaborate and engage with external and internal stakeholders such as business teams, product owners, project management in defining the roadmap for products and processes. Act as point of contact in resolving stakeholder issues and coordinate the third-party relationship with outsourced team and vendors for applications and troubleshoots problems with department users and administrators; responsible for managing development teams

  • Be a Decision Maker: Make quick and effective data-driven decisions, with good problem solving and analytical skills to infer qualitative and quantitative data and roll-out strategy that aligns with company goals.

  • Focus on Continuous improvement and technical standards: Drive improvements in productivity, architecture for software development, prepare technical specifications and, leverage development best practices as a part of daily responsibilities like code review, build and release, etc.

  • Be a People Leader: Coach and mentor current and future leaders within the team, be responsible for identifying individual training needs proactively and maintain a healthy team culture

  • Be a Project Leader: Train/coach team members in technical delivery. Strategically plan, design, and implement software to deliver value to customers, managing multiple projects simultaneously.

About You

You are fit for the role of a Senior AEM Engineer if you have:

  • 3+ years of Web Development experience building scalable, reusable frontend components and experiences in Adobe Experience Manager (AEM Sites 6.4 and higher versions)

  • Deep technical skills in web development technologies (Java, HTML5, JavaScript, TypeScript, CSS, XML/JSON)

  • Strong ReactJS and Typescript programming skills developing on AEM Sites leveraging traditional development as well as the AEM SPA Editor

  • Strong Technical foundation of Web Content Management and AEM centric development of Web Components in HTL, Editable Templates, Sling Models, Workflows, and Backend Java OSGI Services

  • Proficiency in Apache Sling, JCR Repository, and Apache Felix OSGi Framework

  • Proficiency in using modern AEM artifacts for content and experience exchange leveraging Content Fragment Models, Content Fragments and Experience Fragments

  • Experience integrating front end interfaces with internal and external services using API

  • Experience in using AEM Multisite Manager (MSM) for creating multilingual websites

  • Knowledge of functional, security, and performance testing processes, tools, and metrics

  • Experience in software development concepts/methodology/life-cycle, especially Agile methodology

  • Strong programming and analytical skills, data structures and algorithms, documentation, debugging, collaborative teamwork, conflict resolution, and excellent communication skills

Preferred skills:

  • Working knowledge of architecture & infrastructure considerations for CMS management of AEM Sites, WordPress, Teamsite, as well as other popular CMS applications

  • Familiarity with modern web toolchains (ie. StencilJS) for building reusable, scalable design systems based on Web Components

  • Experience in working with Adobe Cloud Manager and Adobe Managed Services

  • Proficiency in Digital Asset Management concepts to effectively leverage AEM Assets as the Enterprise DAM in Thomson Reuters

  • Experience with Adobe Marketing Cloud Products such as Adobe Analytics, Adobe Target, Adobe Audience Manager, and Adobe Launch

  • Experience in working with Adobe Dynamic Media alongside AEM Assets

  • Proficiency with DevOps tools like Git, Maven, NPM, Gulp, Jenkins, AWS, SonarQube, Veracode, Docker, Kubernetes, etc.

What’s in it For You?

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

  • COVID-19 Response: Currently working remotely and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines with the majority of our offices being remote until July 2021. Upon return, we will be embracing a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work

  • Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more

  • Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing

  • Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking

  • Social Impact: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. item.title: Application Architect - Kubernetes
item.description:
As an employee at Thomson Reuters, you will play a role in shaping and leading the global knowledge economy. Our technology drives global markets and helps professionals around the world make decisions that matter. Whether solving today\'s challenges or tomorrow\'s aspirations, you will work with the industry\'s brightest thinkers on diverse projects, creating next-generation solutions that deliver powerful results. As the world\'s leading provider of intelligent information, we want your unique perspective to develop solutions that advance our business and your career.  

 

Thomson Reuters Indirect Tax Group is responsible for a suite of highly available, mission-critical products, which enable our large-scale global customers to compute tax for every transaction that flows through their systems worldwide. The transactions ranged from online transactions generated from travel sites, e-commerce sites; transactions at points of sale for retail customers; transactions between participating businesses across 190 countries worldwide. Are you passionate about building large, scalable, highly available, 24 / 7 mission-critical systems deployed in the cloud? If so, join us at our Toronto Technology Centre, and help shape the product\'s future and take it to new heights. 

 

About the Role  

In this opportunity as an Application Architect, you will:  

  • Be a Technical Leader: Research and recommend technical standards and best practices, ensure the architecture and design is well communicated and fits with overall technology and product strategy, and be hands-on in required areas to implement core components reusable across applications. 

  • Be a Decision Maker: Make quick and effective data-driven decisions, with good problem solving and analytical skills to infer qualitative and quantitative data and roll-out strategy that aligns with company goals. 

  • Be a Team Player – the ability to work in a collaborative team-oriented environment, share information, diverse ideas, partner with cross-functional and remote teams. 

  • Be Curious & Innovative – continuously update yourself with next-generation technology, development tools, and contribute to process development practices.  

  • Be an Agile Person – with a strong sense of urgency and a desire to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment to deliver solutions against strict timelines.  

  • Be an efficient Stakeholder Manager: Collaborate and engage with external and internal stakeholders such as business teams, product owners, project management in defining a road map for products and processes. Act as point of contact in resolving stakeholder issues 

  • Focus on quality, continuous improvement, and technical standards – keep service focus on reliability, performance, and scalability while driving productivity and software development/architecture improvements. Prepare technical specifications and align with industry best practices. 

  • Be an Effective Communicator – the ability to articulate complex technical issues, and share ideas, participate in peer-reviews, and exhibit strong listening skills. Work with the business owners to translate requirements into actionable architectures.  

  

About You  

You\'re a fit for the role of an Application Architect, if you have:  

  • 10+ years of professional experience designing, developing, deploying, and supporting products in an enterprise or SaaS environment 

  • Hands-on experience developing distributed applications using frameworks and technologies like Java/J2EE/ Spring frameworks, ORM tools like Hibernate/JPA, and UI frameworks like Angular. 

  • Experience in designing APIs which are highly secured and meets the industry design standards. 

  • Experience in implementing containerized applications using orchestration technologies like Kubernetes, dockers. 

  • Experience in implementing messaging frameworks like Kafka, RabbitMQ. 

  • A strong experience in designing cloud-native applications in microservices architecture pattern which are highly scalable, resilient, and self-healing  

  • Experience in AWS cloud platform (ECS, Lambda, S3, RDS, Aurora, IAM, VPC, WAF, cloud watch, R53, etc.) or any equivalent (like AZURE, GCP,) 

  • A strong understanding of Cloud Security, Application monitoring, and implementing best practices. 

  • Strong knowledge of modern technologies, with proficiency in the areas of automation, DevOps, and system monitoring 

  • Flexibility to do hands-on development for Projects, PoCs. 

  • Experience with relational database systems like Oracle, PostgreSQL, AWS RDS, and monitoring tools like DataDog, NewRelic, etc. 

 

What’s in it For You?

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

  • COVID-19 Response: Currently working remotely and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines with the majority of our offices being remote until August 2021. Upon return, we will be embracing a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work

  • Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more

  • Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing

  • Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking

  • Social Impact: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.

To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. item.title: Solution Architect - CPQ
item.description:
Solution Architect - CPQ

Do you want to help one of the most respected companies in the world reinvent its approach to quoting and order management technology? Are you a strategic thinker with a strong background in solution architecture?  We are looking for you to join our team as a Solution Architect – CPQ. We are recruiting a team of motivated technology professionals to transform how we manage and leverage technology solutions to enable our go to market strategies. This is a unique opportunity for you to join a diverse and global team with centers of excellence in Toronto, Minneapolis and Dallas.

As a CPQ Solution Architect you will be responsible for the conceptual and logical solution architecture of the Quote-to-Cash suite of products, including CPQ (configure/price/quote) and order management. You will also collaborate with key stakeholders to define the CPQ technology architecture roadmap and support the selection and implementation of technologies, including tooling, integration patterns and data interoperability to allow us to seamlessly operate world class selling capabilities.

About the Role

In this opportunity as a CPQ Solution Architect, you will: 

Design a CPQ system architecture to deliver solutions involving bundles (features, options, option constraints, configuration attributes), product rules, price rules, discount schedules, pricing, contracted prices, quote templates, quote processes and custom actions

Recommend new or different technologies that will not only meet project requirements, but also align to business objectives, roadmaps and strategic solutions, as well as to TR’s architecture principles and standards

Deliver: Clear architecture documents, including architecture patterns, decisions, and rationale for those decisions

Mentor/Lead: Act as counselor to business counterparts, customers, and management on requirements and capabilities pertinent to CPQ Technology

Be a Team Player: Working in a collaborative team-oriented environment, you will share information, value diverse ideas, partner with cross functional and remote teams

Be an Agile Person:  with strong sense of urgency and a desire to work in a fast-paced dynamic environment, you will deliver solutions against strict timelines

Be Innovative: you are empowered to try new approaches and learn new technologies. Have a desire to learn and embrace new and emerging technology.

Be an Effective Communicator: Present and communicate the solution architecture to various stakeholders, both technical and business, and be able to explain how the solution design will meet business needs

About You

You’re a fit for the role of CPQ Solution Architect if you:

Hands-on experience with quote to cash technologies including some of the following:

  • CRM (Customer Relationship Management) – Salesforce.com

  • CPQ (Configure, Price, Quote) – Conga / Apttus

  • CLM (Contract Lifecycle Management) - Conga

  • ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) - SAP

  • PLM (Product Lifecycle Management)

  • Digital selling

  • eSignature

  • Integration services and a good understanding of integration technology

  • Strong foundational knowledge of Subscription Software Quote to Cash processes required

  • Industry knowledge of leading Sales, CPQ, and order management technology trends, prior experience in an enterprise Sales organization

  • Experience working in teams who have designed and implemented CPQ technology solutions

  • Skilled in all aspects of system design including tools capability, integration design, data modeling, security & privacy, business process implementation, etc.

  • Have a solid understanding of delivery methodology to help ensure solutions are implemented according to the design/architecture

  • TOGAF certification preferred

  • Bachelor\'s Degree (or equivalent) in Computer Science, IT, related technical field or equivalent work experience.

What’s in it For You

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

  • Learning & Development:

    • Exposure to a wide breadth of leading-edge technology

    • Career growth - ability to work on multiple projects and/or with various teams

    • Professional growth and development opportunity through various training programs, conferences, networking events, in-house speaker series etc.

    • Access to Hackathons, Unconferences, Harvard Manage Mentor and more, we offer learning opportunities for everyone

  • Benefits/Perks: 

    • Health benefits

    • Savings/investment plans

    • Paid time off (including time off to volunteer and extended parental leave)

  • Flexibility: We\'ve been named as one of Forbes, Best Companies for Work/Life Balance

  • Global Opportunities:  We have employees in over 90 countries, working across 3 different industries

  • Your wellbeing:  We offer a program that focuses on making our lives healthier

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. item.title: Business Process Analyst/Coordinator
item.description:
Job Description

We are currently seeking a business process analyst and coordinator who can help us manage the way Thomson Reuter’s provides value to our customers at an enterprise scale.  This position is within our infrastructure hosting and networks team, which provides a cloud center of excellence to the company.  In this role, you will collaborate with technology and business partners to design and coordinate our business governance process across product and technology, that will ensure our next product strategies are realized.  

As part of the infrastructure, hosting and networks organization, you will be part of a fast-paced, entrepreneurial, energetic, and high performing team at the heart of the Thomson Reuters transformation to an operating company from a holding company. This role will be instrumental to enabling the current and future of how we deliver our products at Thomson Reuters.  

Here’s how the position will look. 

 

About the Role

As a Business Process Analyst/Coordinator, you will

  • Develop relationships with and understand roles of key business process owners and subject matter experts to identify, develop, and implement improvement initiatives across the organization.  

  • Manage key business relationships and expectations by leveraging the defined communication processes throughout the enterprise.  

  • Influence technology strategy through data-driven analysis and strong business case creation and delivery.  

  • Proactively influence both technical and non-technical audiences across the organization to adopt new or updated processes.   

  • Develop, report, and enhance processes based on data driven reporting and metrics. 

 

Business Process Implementation

  • Develop subject matter expertise in workflow tooling through both a program management and development backlog lens.  

  • Apply subject matter expertise in assisting teams to leverage full capabilities of the workflow tool.  

  • Create, update, and communicate workflow tool best practices for both technical and non-technical audiences.  

 

Business Process Coordination 

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to effectively manage and deliver on large-scale, multi-year projects. 

  • Coordinate a smooth experience for consumers of these business processes 

  • Identify requests that are stuck in the process and move them along 

  • Manage agendas for standards committees 

 

 About You

You\'re a fit for the role of Business Process Analyst/Coordinator if you have:

  • Project management and Agile experience  

  • Ability to balance multiple high priority projects in multiple areas across the organization 

  • Experience owning and building processes with minimal direction or requirements  

  • Strong communication across multiple mediums  

  • Ability to work naturally across team and department boundaries 

  • Experience managing projects and workflow with Azure DevOps strongly preferred 

  • Lean / Six Sigma certifications not required but encouraged 

What\'s in it For You

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

  • Learning & Development: 
  • Exposure to a wide breadth of leading-edge technology
  • Career growth - the ability to work on multiple projects and/or with various teams
  • Professional growth and development opportunity through various training programs, conferences, networking events, in-house speaker series etc.
  • Access to Hackathons, Unconferences, Harvard Manage Mentor and more, we offer learning opportunities for everyone
  • Benefits/Perks: 
    • Health benefits
    • Savings/investment plans
    • Paid time off (including time off to volunteer and extended parental leave)
  • Flexibility: We\'ve been named as one of Forbes, Best Companies for Work/Life Balance
  • Global Opportunities:  We have employees in over 90 countries, working across three different industries
  • Your well-being:  We offer a program that focuses on making our lives healthier

item.title: Director, Product Reliability & Operations
item.description:
Thomson Reuters Technology team is seeking a Director of Product Reliability and Operations.  This position will lead a global technology group that operates enterprise application systems supporting multiple Thomson Reuters products in the Legal space.  This operations team manages ongoing change planning and implementation, incident detection and resolution, compliance, and reliability engineering for products hosted in Thomson Reuters data centers and the public cloud.

About the Role 

In this opportunity as a Director Product Reliability and Operations you will:

Deliver:

  • Deliver reliable 24x7 operations meeting business expectations across the product portfolio

  • Serve as the management escalation and executive communications point during major issues 24x7, including engagement outside of core business hours when needed

Stakeholder management:

  • Partner with application development teams to deliver operational readiness for new products and features

  • Partner with security, data center, and service governance teams to deliver compliance with internal and external standards, expectations, and certifications

Be a people leader:

  • Manage a diverse set of global application reliability and operations teams

  • Deliver effective talent management practices and optimize use of talent across the broader technology organization

  • Manage team and project financials

  • Manage vendor relationships for third party labor and services

  • Foster agility in the development processes and achieve optimal time to market for product offerings

  • Some travel may be required as this position manages a global team

About You 

      You\'re a fit for the role of Director Product Reliability and Operations if you have: 

        Education, Skills and Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent required, preferably in a software engineering or related discipline

  • 7+ years of leadership experience in software development and/or technology infrastructure and operations

  • Broad understanding of the technologies used to build and operate distributed application systems

  • Experience with Agile methodologies and the use of modern Cloud and SaaS technologies and systems

  • Excellent critical thinking, communication, presentation, documentation, troubleshooting and collaborative problem-solving skills

       Behaviors and Ways of Working:

  • A management style that is collaborative, energetic, and results-oriented

  • Comfortable operating in a dynamic, fast-changing and innovative environment

  • Ability to influence others and drive consensus across stakeholder groups

  • Ability to flex styles to work well with a range of personalities from extremely technical team members to non-technical business leaders

  • Comfortable in a fast-paced environment and motivated by complex technical and business challenges

What’s in it For You?

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

  • Learning & Development:

    • On-the-job coaching & learning, tuition reimbursement, exposure to leading-edge technology

    • Career growth - ability to work on multiple projects and/or with various teams

  • Benefits: Flexible work arrangements, comprehensive health coverage that’s effective day one

item.title: Enterprise Architect, O2C and Finance
item.description:
Enterprise Architect – Order to Cash and Finance, Technology

As an employee at Thomson Reuters, you will play a role in shaping and leading the global knowledge economy. Our technology drives global markets and helps professionals around the world make decisions that matter.  Whether solving for today’s challenges or tomorrow’s aspirations, you will work with the industry’s brightest thinkers on diverse projects, creating next-generation solutions that deliver powerful results.   As the world’s leading provider of intelligent information, we want your unique perspective to create the solutions that advance our business—and your career. 

Thomson Reuters is currently implementing a large digital transformation programme, to fundamentally transform our Lead to Support processes and enable Digital. Order to Cash and Finance plays a critical role in digital transformation and this role play a pivotal role in defining the Order to Cash and Finance technology strategy & roadmap, developing the relevant architectures and governing the solutions end to end.

About the Role

In this opportunity as Enterprise Architect – Order to Cash and Finance, Technology you will: 

  • Be a People Leader: build and manage a team of solution architects with varied skills and experience level. Coach and mentor current and future leaders within the team, be responsible to proactively identify individual training needs, conduct performance reviews and maintain a healthy team culture
  • Be a Project Leader: train/coach team members in project delivery. Strategically plan, design and implement software to deliver value to customers, managing multiple projects simultaneously
  • Be an Architecture Leader: Acting as the go to individual for technology and architecture decisions within the Global Order to Cash and Finance organisation and ensuring these decisions are based on commercial and technical factors, are aligned with TR’s strategic direction and are compatible with the wider Enterprise Architecture
  • Be an efficient Stakeholder Manager: collaborate and engage with external and internal stakeholders such as business teams, product owners, project management in defining roadmap for products and processes. Act as point of contact in resolving stakeholder issues
  • Be a Decision Maker: make quick and effective data driven decisions, with good problem solving and analytical skills to infer qualitative and quantitative data, and roll out strategy that aligns with company goals
  • Be Responsible for:
    • Architecture Strategy & Roadmap - define and update architecture strategy for Order to Cash and Finance roadmap, keeping abreast with current and emerging technology trends within the domain. Responsible for the delivery of architecture artefacts including target and transition architectures and roadmaps
    • Architecture design for enterprise processes, integrations and applications to support the Order to Cash and Finance vision and objectives.
    • Architecture Governance – run and co-chair the architecture review boards and design authorities

About You

Essential Experience, Skills And Knowledge

  • Experience working in a large global organisation as a senior architect, ideally with a heavy Digital architecture focus
  • Delivered Enterprise or Solution Architecture across multiple technology and application domains solving complex business issues
  • Led global teams of architects, both directly and indirectly via a matrix approach
  • Managed stakeholders at all levels in an organisation, including to ‘C-Level’

Technical / Functional / Leadership Skills Required

  • An excellent knowledge of current and emerging B2B/B2B2C/B2C Order to Cash and Finance models and technologies including SAP S/4HANA, SAP BRIM, SAP ERP, SAP Finance, Collections and Payment architectures including High Radius, Paymetric, Customer 360 etc
  • Have expertise in driving Global Order to Cash and Finance strategy and execution, while establishing strategic partnerships and delivering against business requirements
  • Experience in Convergent Billing, Invoicing, Charging and other billing models such as Usage
  • Experience in implementing Subscription and transaction-based business models
  • Experience in implementing Finance Transformations programs including Central Finance consolidation
  • Enterprise Architecture including good knowledge of TOGAF and strong skills in architecture modelling techniques like business and technology capability modelling, maturity modelling, change readiness assessments, impact assessments etc.
  • Experience in creating Conceptual, Logical and Physical architecture views and communicating them to respective audiences
  • Lead Solution Architecture on major programmes
  • Architecture governance and design authority to ensure solutions are in line with the overall data and analytics strategy
  • An effective communicator with relevant experience leading and influencing others, demonstrating an ability to partner effectively with internal and external partners.
  • TOGAF architecture certification
  • Business acumen, ability to articulate both business, commercial and technical ideas clearly and simply
  • Consulting skills to engage, communicate with and influence stakeholders effectively
  • Commercial skills (understand and consider financial implications of proposals)
  • Effective communication, engagement, and relationship management skills
  • Effective facilitation, influencing and negotiation skills
  • Have a bachelor\'s degree (or equivalent) in Computer Science, Computer/Software Engineering or related technical field is preferred

What’s in it For You

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

  • Learning & Development: Exposure to a wide breadth of leading-edge technology 
  • Career growth - ability to work on multiple projects and/or with various teams 
  • Professional growth and development opportunity through various training programs, conferences, networking events, in-house speaker series etc. 
  • Access to Hackathons, Unconferences, Harvard Manage Mentor and more, we offer learning opportunities for everyone 
  • Health benefits 
  • Savings/investment plans 
  • Paid time off (including time off to volunteer and extended parental leave) 
  • We\'ve been named as one of Forbes, Best Companies for Work/Life Balance 
  • Global Opportunities:  We have employees in over 90 countries, working across 3 different industries 
  • Your wellbeing:  We offer programs that focus on making our lives healthier
