item.title: Manager - Service Improvement (Security engineering)
item.description:
About the Role

As Manager, Security Engineering Service Improvement, you will be responsible for designing and implementing a service delivery framework that Security Engineering will use to drive service improvement opportunities. You will proactively identify and lead service improvement initiatives in collaboration with our Security Engineering Platforms, Identity & Access Management and Security Software Engineering teams. You will be accountable for targeted service improvement plans, core service level management activities supporting Security Engineering service experience with all of our consumers, including measurement, analysis, and reporting of key service performance. This includes day-to-day management and prioritization of service improvement plan activities. You will partner with leaders across Security Engineering to develop a shared vision for service improvement. 

About You

In this opportunity as a Manager, Service Improvement : 

  • You are passionate about continuous service improvement and embrace change.  
  • You thrive on data and analytics to drive insights.  
  • You develop and maintain strong interpersonal relationships, being able to work across a variety of stakeholders (eg. Information Security & Risk Management teams, Product Engineering, Infrastructure Hosting & Networks, Digital, Employees & Partners, etc…) to gather input, facilitate discussions, review materials, solve problems and build consensus.
  • You are a strong communicator, with a drive and ability to shift organizational behaviours
  • You have the ability to synthesize information security content and simplify down to key messages that can be easily communicated.  
  • You are a bold and accountable leader who can deliver multiple programs.
  • You\'re passionate about delivery excellence.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your authentic self to work and you live our values.  

Qualifications

You’re a fit for the role of Manager, Service Improvement  if you have:

Required Skills

  • Proven capability and experience in integrating and managing service improvements involving multiple service providers
  • IT Service Management and standards experience 
  • Experience with case management tools (e.g., ServiceNow) and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI)
  • A passion for innovation combined with an “engineering mindset”
  • Ability in managing multiple projects, while meeting deadlines and managing key issues & risks
  • Leadership, collaboration, and interpersonal skills with a demonstrated ability to work effectively and build consensus in a multi-functional team environment
  • Problem solving and decision-making skills with the ability to work under pressure in a dynamic environment
  • Good communication (verbal/written) and good interpersonal skills to build relationships with internal and external stakeholders
  • Ability to drive change across a large number of stakeholders
  • Understanding and applying risk management principles to effectively manage cyber risk
  • Ability to gain commitment, trust and support from others and be able to sell ideas inside and outside the organization
  • Challenge status quo
  • Exhibit a mindset of creativity, determination, and an energetic drive to succeed
  • Track record of setting and meeting aggressive goals and action plans, both as an individual and with a team

Preferred Skills

  • Familiar with DevOps and Agile methodologies
  • ITIL Certification
  • Technical experience in the context of SRE/Transformation
  • Excellent knowledge and relevant experience in security domains related to Identity and Access Management, End Point Protection, Network Security and Email/Office 365 Security 
  • Industry recognized certification in security (e.g., CISSP, CISA, etc.) 

What’s in it for you

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth: 

  • Learning & Development: On-the-job coaching & learning, tuition reimbursement, exposure to leading-edge technology. Career growth - ability to work on multiple projects and/or with various teams. Access to Hackathons, Unconferences, Harvard Manage Mentor and more, we offer learning opportunities for everyone 
  • Benefits: Flexible work arrangements, comprehensive health coverage that’s effective day one 
  • Perks: Social events & activities, employee discount programs through corporate perks
  • Flexibility: We\'ve been named as one of Forbes, Best Companies for Work/Life Balance 
  • Global Opportunities:  We have employees in over 90 countries, working across 3 different industries 
  • Your wellbeing:  We offer a program that focuses on making our lives healthier​

item.title: Associate Architect
item.description:
Associate Architect

As a technologist at Thomson Reuters, you will help shape the global knowledge economy. Our technology ensures that professionals around the world have the answers they need. You will work with the brightest thinkers on diverse projects, creating next-generation solutions that deliver powerful results. As the world’s top provider of intelligent information, we want your unique perspective to create the solutions that advance our business—and your career. Bring your passion for innovation, and together we’ll make a difference.


About the Role 

In this role you will:

  • Be a Technical Leader – provide thought leadership and guidance in setting the architecture vision and direction for a robust and scalable set of services that enable the creation and deployment of AI/ML solutions for processing documents. Work with technology teams and beyond to realize their implementation.
  • Be a Team Player – ability to work in a collaborative and inclusive team-oriented environment, partner with cross functional and remote teams, draw out strong design ideas from diverse teams and high performing engineers, and translate requirements into actionable architecture.
  • Be an Effective Communicator – ability to concisely and completely articulate complex technical issues – verbal and visual; ability to target your audience, actively listen, and value diverse ideas.
  • Be an Agile Person – with a strong sense of urgency and a desire to work in a fast-paced dynamic environment to deliver solutions against strict timelines.
  • Be Curious & Innovative – ability to question the status quo.  Continuously update yourself with industry trends, next generation technology, and software development best practices. 

About You

  • Experience in software design, methodologies (Agile), and tools (MS ADO, Lucidchart)
  • Broad experience in cloud based (AWS), full-stack, design and development including use of the following technologies: Java, Python, Front-End Technologies (e.g., JavaScript, Angular), XML (DOM, SAX), Database and Storage (Postgres, Oracle, DynamoDB, S3), Messaging Technologies (SQN/SNS), APIs (Microservices and Serverless), Big Data (Glue, Spark, Parquet), MLOps (Sagemaker).
  • Must be an excellent communicator when speaking, writing, and in diagramming.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills with an ability to operate across organizational boundaries and to influence business stakeholders, as well as technology peers.
  • Advanced analytical skills with the ability to synthesize business requirements with technology capabilities to produce coherent technical designs.
  • Demonstrated ability to quickly learn, analyze and prototype new technologies.
  • Have 5+years relevant experience in large distributed/cloud systems, including 1+ years architecture / design experience.
  • You may also have:
    • Cloud experience (AWS or Azure)
    • Experience in Cognitive Computing (e.g, Machine Learning, NLP/NER, Classification, Clustering)
    • Architecting API-first solutions
    • Experience in processing large volumes of data
    • System load and scale testing
    • CICD and Automation

What’s in it For You

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

  • Learning & Development: On-the-job coaching & learning, tuition reimbursement, exposure to cutting-edge technology
  • Benefits: Flexible work arrangements, comprehensive health coverage that’s effective day one
  • Perks: Social events & activities, employee discount programs through corporate perks

item.title: Applied Research Scientist - NLP/ML
item.description:
Are you excited about working at the forefront of applied research in an industry setting? Thomson Reuters Labs in Toronto and Minneapolis is seeking scientists with a passion for solving problems using state-of-the-art Information Retrieval, Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing.

What does Thomson Reuters Labs do? We experiment, we build, we deliver. We support the organization and our customers through applied research and the development of new products and technologies. TR Labs innovates collaboratively across our core segments in Legal, Tax & Accounting, Government, and Reuters News. We undertake a diverse portfolio of projects today while investing in long-term research for the future.

As a scientist in Labs, you will be part of a global interdisciplinary team of experts. We hire specialists across a variety of AI research areas, as well as Engineering and Design, to drive the company\'s digital transformation. TR Labs is known for consistently delivering projects that advance the state of the art in support of high-growth products and serve Thomson Reuters customers in new and exciting ways.

More about Thomson Reuters Labs - http://tr.com/ai-jobs

About the role

In this opportunity as an Applied Research Scientist, you will:

  • Experiment and Develop: You will execute the entire model development lifecycle, building, testing and delivering high-quality solutions. You will apply best practices to conduct reproducible research and well-managed software delivery.

  • Collaborate: Working on a collaborative cross-functional team, you will share information, value diverse ideas, and partner effectively with colleagues across the globe.

  • Delivery: You will be accountable for timely, well-managed deliverables.

  • Innovate: You will be empowered to try new approaches and learn new technologies.

  • Inspire: You will be a proactive communicator who is excited to share your work. You will be articulate and compelling in describing ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences.

About you

You are a fit for the role of an Applied Research Scientist if you have:

  • Ph.D. in a relevant discipline or Master\'s plus a comparable level of experience

  • At least one year of industry experience building IR/NLP/ML systems

  • Solid software engineering skills for prototyping

Preferred qualifications

  • 5+ years academic or industry experience building IR, ML or NLP systems with the demonstrated ability to translate cutting edge research into working applications

  • Proficiency in Python, Java, or Scala and experience delivering minimum viable products in a large enterprise environment

  • Proven communication skills and ability to work on deliverables independently

  • Publications at workshops or conferences such as ACL, EMNLP, NAACL, SIGIR, NeurIPS, or similar

What\'s in it for you

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. In addition to rewarding and challenging work with exceptional colleagues, we offer the following benefits for your personal and professional growth:

  • Learning & Development: On-the-job coaching & learning, tuition reimbursement, exposure to leading-edge technology

  • Our Scientists and Engineers get to play with big data sets to discover new products, capabilities, and insights for our customers. Thomson Reuters is most well-known for the globally respected Reuters News agency, but our company is also the leading source of information for legal, corporate and tax professionals. We have over 60,000 TBs worth of legal, regulatory, news, and tax data.

  • Benefits: Flexible work arrangements, comprehensive health coverage effective day one, savings and investment plans

  • Perks: Social events & activities, employee discount programs

  • Social Impact: Paid time off for volunteering virtually or in your community

Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. item.title: Deep Learning Engineering Intern, Content & Technology - Fall 2021
item.description:
We are looking for Deep Learning Interns for our Simulation Technology team! Do you have a passion for computer gaming, virtual reality, computer vision, and artificial intelligence?

Ever dream about inventing your own holodeck? Do you want to work on leading-edge problems alongside some of the best and brightest people in the world? NVIDIA has continuously reinvented itself over two decades. Our invention of the GPU in 1999 sparked the growth of the PC gaming market, redefined modern computer graphics, and revolutionized parallel computing. More recently, GPU deep learning ignited modern AI — the next era of computing. NVIDIA is a “learning machine” company that constantly evolves by adapting to new opportunities that are hard to solve, that only we can pursue, and that matter to the world. This is our life’s work, to amplify human creativity and intelligence.

What you will be doing:

  • You will apply deep learning techniques to the simulation of virtual environments, developing methods to generate synthetic data for training neural networks to achieve results comparable to networks trained on real data

  • Work on improving realism for agents in synthetic environments – using reinforcement learning techniques to control behavior and animation of simulated characters, crowds, and vehicles

  • Conduct research into novel Deep Learning network architectures and techniques for achieving the above.

  • Perform additional development around related technologies as applied to games, VR and visual effects applications.

What we need to see:

  • Currently pursuing a PhD, MS, or BS in Computer Science or related field.

  • 1+ year experience with C++/C, CUDA, DirectX, or OpenGL in addition to Python, PyTorch and TensorFlow.

  • Expertise in neural networks, computer graphics, simulation or game development.

  • Dedication to producing high quality and creative results

Ways to stand out from the crowd:

  • You are a great communicator and self-motivated towards team goals
  • You welcome mentoring others around you
  • Sharp mathematics skills

NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the brightest people in the world working for us and, due to unprecedented growth, our elite engineering teams are rapidly growing. If you\'re a creative and autonomous engineer with a real passion for technology, we want to hear from you.

#deeplearning

item.title: Compute Performance Developer Technology Engineer - CUDA
item.description:
Compute Performance Developer Technology Engineer.

NVIDIA is hiring passionate, world-class computer scientists to work in its Compute Developer Technology (Devtech) team.

What you will be doing:

In this role, you will research and develop techniques to GPU-accelerate leading applications in high performance computing fields within scientific computing, computational engineering, and data science. You will be performing in-depth analysis and optimization to ensure the best possible performance on current and next-generation GPU architectures. This involves:

  • Working directly with key application developers to understand the current and future problems they are solving, crafting and optimizing core parallel algorithms and data structures to provide the best solutions using GPUs, through both reference code development and direct contribution to the applications.
  • Collaborating closely with diverse groups at NVIDIA such as the architecture, research, libraries, tools, and system software teams to influence the design of next-generation architectures, software platforms, and programming models, by investigating the impact on application performance and developer productivity.
  • You will need to travel from time to time for conferences and for on-site visits with developers.

What we need to see:

  • A BS, MS, or PhD degree from a leading university in an engineering or computer science related discipline with 3+ years of relevant experience. While not a requirement, domain expertise in telecommunications, medical imaging, machine learning, deep learning, or natural sciences is helpful.
  • Programming fluency in C/C++ and/or Fortran with a deep understanding of software design, programming techniques, and algorithms.
  • Strong mathematical fundamentals, including linear algebra and numerical methods.
  • Experience with parallel programming, ideally CUDA C/C++ and OpenACC.
  • Strong communication and organization skills, with a logical approach to problem solving, good time management, and task prioritization skills.

With highly competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package, NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology industry\'s most desirable employers. We have some of the most brilliant and talented people in the world working with us and our engineering teams are growing fast in some of the hottest and state of the art fields: Deep Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Autonomous Vehicles, Supercomputing and more. Are you a creative and autonomous computer scientist with a real passion for parallel computing? If so, we want to hear from you.

#deeplearning

item.title: Senior Graphics Tools and Pipeline Engineer - DRIVE Sim
item.description:
Autonomous vehicles are redefining the way we live, work, and play—creating safer and more efficient roads. These revolutionary benefits require massive computational horsepower and large-scale production software expertise. Tapping into decades-long experience in high-performance computing, imaging, and AI, NVIDIA has built a software-defined, end-to-end platform for the transportation industry that enables continuous improvement and continuous deployment through over the air updates. It delivers everything needed to develop autonomous vehicles at scale.

Simulation gives us the capability to test an autonomous vehicle in a near-infinite variety of conditions and scenarios before it even reaches the road, accelerating development time and improving the reliability of the self-driving stack at the same time. We’re looking for a talented Graphics Tools and Pipeline Engineer to join the DRIVE Sim team and help make it all a reality. This meaningful role will see you working with technical visionaries within the company to define and deliver a simulation environment that advances the state of the art in autonomous vehicles.

What you will be doing:

Priorities often change in a fast-paced environment like ours. Some of the things you will work on:

  • Design and development of asset creation and management tools ranging from exporters, to content creation tools, to asset management tools, and even implement real-time runtime functionality for specific types of content

  • Work with content creators, designers, and other specialists to capture requirements and ensure tool design specifications are met

  • Work with the design team to architect, engineer, and implement new systems and tools to facilitate the creation of exciting new content

  • Directly impact the future of self-driving car technology!

What we need to see:

  • Bachelor of Science or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Applied Math, or related field or equivalent work experience

  • 4+ years of experience

  • Solid C++ skills

  • Experience developing plugins for DCC tools like Maya or Max

  • Experience programming runtime logic for games such as handling animation / camera / state machines

  • Excellent Python scripting skills

  • Programming with an eye for performance

  • Experience working with of 3D content toolchains

  • Strong mathematical fundamentals, including linear algebra and numerical methods

Ways to stand out from the crowd:

  • Experience with data-parallel and/or accelerated computing (CUDA, OpenCL)

  • Background with game engine development

  • Experience working with cloud-based services

  • Familiarity with an existing game engine with an understanding of game engine and editor concepts

  • Experience writing UIs with a toolkit such as wxWidgets, WPF, QT, Slate

NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most forward-thinking and hardworking people in the world working for us. If you\'re creative and autonomous, we want to hear from you!

item.title: Senior Verification Engineer
item.description:
We are looking for a Senior Verification Engineer for Memory Controllers.

For two decades, we have pioneered visual computing, the art and science of computer graphics. With our invention of the GPU - the engine of modern visual computing - the field has grown to encompass video games, movie production, product design, medical diagnosis and scientific research. Today, we stand at the beginning of the next era, the AI computing era, ignited by a new computing model, GPU deep learning. This new model - where deep neural networks are trained to recognize patterns from massive amounts of data - has shown to be deeply effective at solving the most complex problems in everyday life.

As a Verification Engineer at NVIDIA, you will verify the design and implementation of our state of the art memory subsystem for our mobile SoCs and GPUs. This position offers the opportunity to have real impact in a dynamic, technology-focused company impacting product lines ranging from consumer graphics to self-driving cars and the growing field of artificial intelligence. We have crafted a team of outstanding people stretching around the globe, whose mission is to push the frontiers of what is possible today and define the platform for the future of computing.

What you will be doing:

  • In this position, you will be responsible for verification of memory subsystem design, architecture, golden models and micro-architecture using advanced verification methodologies.

  • As an intermediate to senior member of our verification team, you\'ll understand the design & implementation, define the verification scope, develop the verification infrastructure (Testbenches, BFMs, Checkers, Monitors), execute test/coverage plans, and verify the correctness of the design.

  • Collaborate with architects, designers, emulation and silicon verification teams to accomplish your tasks.

What we need to see:

  • Bachelors, Master\'s or PhD Degree in a related field (or equivalent experience).

  • Minimum of 4 years of professional experience.

  • Experience developing TB\'s from scratch using SV and UVM methodology.

  • Background in developing test bench environments for unit level verification.

  • Experience in verification using random stimulus along with functional coverage and assertion-based verification methodologies.

  • Prior Design or Verification experience of dynamic memory controllers (ddr{2, 3, 4}, lpddr{2, 3,4,5},Gddr{5,6},HBM{1, 2}) and/or high-speed interconnects.

  • Strong C++ programming experience, scripting ability and experience with System Verilog is highly preferred.

  • Exposure to design and verification tools (VCS or equivalent simulation tools, debug tools like Debussy, GDB).

  • Strong debugging, problem solving and analytical skills.

  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills are required.

  • Ability to work in a geographically diverse team environment.

  • Self motivated, ability to work independently and drive tasks to completion.

NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most forward-thinking and hardworking people in the world working for us. Are you creative and autonomous? Do you love the challenge of crafting the highest performance & lowest power silicon possible? If so, we want to hear from you. Come, join our Memory Subsystem Design Team and help build the real-time, cost-effective computing platform driving our success in this exciting and quickly growing field.​

item.title: Analytics Leadership Program Associate
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

The Consultant, Enterprise Data Analytics is responsible for providing advanced data analytics, consultation and analytical support, along with meaningful insights, to help solve strategic business problems and ensure operational consistency. The role uses independent judgement to determine methods and approaches to work, applying  statistical data modeling, predictive modelling, machine learning, and data visualization skills to propose meaningful insights throughout the organization. The Consultant, Enterprise Data Analytics acts as a resource integrator for their area, leading and supporting in-depth client insight studies and creating an analytical framework to help solve key business questions and hypotheses. The role applies advanced concepts to lead and assist in the development of presentations that highlight key insights from strategic analysis along with recommendations to help address gaps or opportunities. In addition, the role actively collaborates with other business partners to identify new sources of data that can be leveraged to develop insights that lead to new opportunities.

You will create logical data model using best practices to ensure high data quality and reduced redundancy and optimize and update logical data models to support new and existing projects as well as maintain conceptual, logical and physical data models along with corresponding metadata.

In this role, you will join the CIBC’s Big Data team in a Senior Cloud Consultant capacity and you will provide subject matter expertise to Big Data Cloud initiatives as they relate to the design, implementation and support of Azure cloud technologies and tooling.  This role will  require good knowledge on CIBC Cloud offerings and will be representing the big data team in the Cloud Design Authority forum.  As a member of CIBC’s Big Data team you will provide technical leadership, standards, best practices, review and support with TO requirements to Big Data Project teams during design, build, configuration, implementation and maintenance phases of the Cloud projects. You will work closely with other Big Data tech leads to provide guidance on Cloud project implementations.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Leadership & Communication – Collaborate with senior leaders and tech leads across the team and make informed recommendations to enhance Big Data related solutions. Weigh business needs against technology offerings, security concerns and CIBC roadmap to provide solution recommendations which are practical and achievable.

  • Develop & Design – Lead or coach the design and development of Big Data projects in Cloud

  • Solution Design: Promote awareness and understanding of solutions being proposed by attending project and program meetings, influencing planning, designing, leading and facilitating forums and discussions with business partners, designers, architects, developers and vendors as needed. Attend TO Requirements sessions and help bridge the gap between the application delivery team and the TO Solutioning team.

  • Mentor and Coach – Mentor and Coach tech leads and developers on best cloud practices at CIBC and help bridge the gap on cross tech team collaboration.

  • Managing Multiple Priorities: Manage multiple concurrent objectives, projects or activities. Effective judgment in prioritizing and time allocation. Ability to process information with high levels of accuracy.

    • 4+  years of hands-on expertise with Azure or other Cloud provider technologies. It’s an asset if you have relevant Azure certifications such as AZ-203, AZ-303, AZ-304, AZ-400 or equivalent knowledge.

    • 2 years hands on experience with Data Cloud services such as Azure Data Factory, Databricks,  Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Blob, SQL Server

    • Good knowledge of Azure Devops, Azure Monitor, Azure Synapse (Formerly SQL Data Warehouse), Azure Data Catalogue/Purview, CosmosDB.

    • Good knowledge of Azure Identity and Access management (RBAC, AAD, SPN).

    • It’s an asset if you have hands on working experience with Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, Hive, HBase, Oozie, HiveQL, Hive UDFs, Sqoop, Spark, Impala.

item.title: Senior Consultant, Data Security Services
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

Job Overview

As a Senior Consultant, you will join CIBC\'s Information Security department to continue our journey and evolve the enterprise wide Application and Data Security programs, which strive to ensure that all applications and data across the enterprise have security built into their life cycle, thereby enhancing CIBC’s overall security landscape and protecting Our Bank, Our Clients, and Our Employees.

What You’ll Be Doing

  • Provide strategic thought leadership, building and regularly updating our banks strategic roadmaps and product backlogs for the domain of Data Security.

  • Oversee multiple data security projects and managing stakeholders to meet the project timelines and compliance requirements.\\

  • Lead the evaluation of new and proposed security systems and technologies to improve data protection of enterprise critical assets and Digital Crown Jewels.

  • Collaborate with key architecture, development, operations and infrastructure stakeholders to implement continuous improvements, identify new business requirements and govern the effectiveness of data security services and controls

  • Act as a trusted advisor and security ambassador, influencing the enterprise teams to build security into their design, operating and development pipelines.

  • Direct the review, development, testing and implementation of security plans, products and control techniques

  • Support and promote the security culture and strategy while influencing infrastructure and application design activities.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Service Governance - Manage and oversee the development and maintenance of strategic roadmaps for the domain of Data Security. Collaborate with various stakeholders on requirements, develop business cases and lead subsequent projects (including POCs) as product owner to support the strategy. Maintain a continuous improvement mindset, always looking for opportunities for efficiency and to enhance the security of the domain.

  • Communication – Build and present documentation to executive management aimed at communicating benefits of proposed security programs, as well as on current potential risks and providing recommendations. Provide awareness and training to the application developments teams of the benefits of web application layer protection services, data protection services, code scanning services, etc. Assess business needs against potential risks and provide your recommendations to enhance our information security landscape.

  • Advisory and Relationship Management - Working with the broader team, act as a trusted advisor to influence the application development, operational and infrastructure teams to build security into their design, development and scanning techniques, and to prioritize security vulnerabilities identified using a risk-based approach. Assist in the the identification, assessment, reporting, and management of security risks and design flaws identified in key applications with practical and achievable recommendations.  Stay on top of the latest threat landscape and maintain relationships with peers from other banks. Manage the vendor relationship for security services and tools used within the domains of Data Security.

  • Data Protection Services - Manage data protection and data security service management related activities, including scheduling, consulting, onboarding, service governance and improvement. Measure the quality of the service protection and conduct threat update reviews, analysis of logs, trends and usage reports. Drive the improvement in the level of security protection for our enterprise data, specifically Digital Crown Jewels and critical assets..

Who You Are

  • You bring passion for industry application security, vulnerability management and data security standards and best practices.

  • You can demonstrate experience in data security concepts in a senior level role. You have implemented data protection methodologies to ensure secure design of applications and protection of confidential data. You have been a key contributor or have led data security initiatives (i.e. encryption/tokenization of data (at rest, in flight, in use), data loss prevention) and have a working understanding of data governance and data privacy concepts.

  • You have the ability to develop strong relationships across various levels of an organization to bring about a positive result and communicate requirements effectively.

  • You’re a certified professional. You have current accreditation and good standing CISSP, CISA, or CISM designation

  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.

  • You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in a meaningful way.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning and comprehensive product training

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

You’ll be joining CIBC’s Private Wealth Management (PWM) Technology group within Wealth Management and will be an integral part of CIBC’s technology transformation. As the Director, Application Development, you will act as the technical subject matter expert with oversight and accountability for Business Analysis, Production Support, Development, QA and Vendor Relations for the Data Analytics & Reporting applications and services supporting the Private Wealth Management business group. With a strong focus on technology strategy, delivery approaches and business acumen, you’ll lead a team delivering technology changes and supporting requirements that align with both the Private Wealth Management line of business and the Wealth Management Technology (WMT) mandates.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Technical Leadership – Drive PWM technology solutions with respect to Data Analytics & Reporting as part of an integrated business and technology roadmap. Design, develop, implement/execute and support technology strategies which include:  Data and Business Analytics strategy, Cloud strategy, Application Modernization/CCR strategy, Application Health-check and Innovation strategy, Process Automation (QA), DevOps adoption.  Provide oversight and leadership of end to end technology solutions involving development, business analysis, QA, vendor relations, production support and development functions supporting the business to meet their objectives.

  • People Leadership – Lead and coach a team of Business Systems Analysts, Application Developers, and Application Support Specialists building on existing individual capabilities and bringing new talent into the team to meet business and technology objectives. Develop your team, maximizing their contributions, encourage out of the box thinking and professional growth. Create a positive work environment through being an effective role model and by championing CIBC’s mission, vision and values, ensuring compliance with policies, standards, guidelines and controls, applying policies fairly and consistently so employees understand what to expect. Manage performance by providing fair and accurate formal and informal feedback, identifying and removing obstacles to performance and by explaining how performance expectations align with business priorities.

  • Relationship Management – Work closely with clients and business partners to develop, test, plan and implement application enhancements. Become familiar for all CIBC enterprise development practices, standards and governance controls for other CIBC groups and technology vendors. Advise on emerging technical trends in the industry and at CIBC, and ensure application services best practices reflect appropriate technological developments for a competitive business position.  Collaborate and support the other PWM Technology teams in the delivery of technology modernization that address the strategic and operational business partner agenda and the CIBC technology strategy.  Analyze technical risk to support business recommendations and make adjustments to internal operations as necessary to improve performance of the Application Delivery and support teams. 

 

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience with: 8+ years\' experience leading, designing, developing, implementing and supporting both in house applications as well as vendor developed and ASP. You have led the creation of a data strategy and associated roadmap and led execution across multiple technologies and projects. Experience in most of the following: Languages (Net, C#, C/C++, Foxpro, Python, Java, Javascript), Databases (Oracle, SQL Server, Sybase), Cloud (Azure, AWS), ETL (Informatica, SSIS), O/S (Sun Solaris, Microsoft Windows), Schedulers etc. (Feedhub, MFTS, Autosys) and Tools (source control/issue management: Git, TFS, JIRA, Azure DevOps), Data and Business Analytics, Application Modernization/CCR, Application Health-check and Innovation, Process Automation (QA) and DevOps adoption. You will utilize your breadth of knowledge to identify opportunities to optimize, modernize, retire or consolidate a large number of applications spanning numerous technologies. You are a seasoned people leader with the ability to coach and help develop other team members. It’s an Asset if:  You have good understanding of the Wealth Management business and have worked in a capacity supporting the business. You have a degree/diploma in: Computer Science, Engineering, and/or a related field.

  • You have a solid understanding of: Managing vendor applications, roadmaps, testing, and implementation. Designing and implementing applications for cloud. Strong knowledge of Agile methodology and experience working in a Scrum team.

  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.

  • You embrace and champion change: You’ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.  You empower and enable your team to make continuous improvement, go above and beyond, and deliver results.

  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of a team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

item.title: Credit Analyst - Global Investment Grade
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What you’ll be doing

This role is a critical driver of CIBC Asset Management fixed income security selection and an integral member of the Fixed Income Team reporting to the Head of Credit Research. The incumbent will contribute to the credit research of global investment grade credit. The role of the Credit Analyst is to provide the Fixed Income Portfolio Managers in-depth advice and consultation of a tactical and strategic nature regarding sector credit exposures and security selection in the fixed income markets.

The incumbent will be responsible for developing and maintaining the financial models, investment theses of various global sectors and companies, including ESG assessment and scoring. Through ongoing dialogue with our Fixed Income Portfolio Managers, and presentations to the Credit Committee, the recommendations emanating from research will drive investment decisions and contribute to achieving portfolio target value added objective for security selection.

How you’ll succeed

  • Develop clear actionable investment recommendations within predetermined Global credit sectors based on underlying credit fundamentals and ESG assessment.  Differentiate and monitor key drivers for outperformance of industries and companies.
  • Develop and maintain financial models and forward-looking estimates for the companies under coverage. Engage in an open and ongoing dialogue with Portfolio Managers and other Credit team members to ensure that the best ideas are incorporated into the respective portfolios.
  • Develop strong working relationships within CIBCAM to collaborate and share knowledge, develop industry views, and to promote and utilize a common research framework. Work collaboratively with equity analysts in the Equity team with respect to company and industry analysis, including ESG evaluations. Present and communicate both internally, to the team and externally, as appropriate, with prospects and clients of the firm.

Who you are

  • Demonstrate experience with 5+ years fixed income research and analysis experience, including US and international companies, and long/short trade ideas. Strong understanding and experience with debt/fixed income analysis, capital markets knowledge, including credit default swaps.  Quantitative skills relating to indicator and model development and familiarity with macro and micro economic data environments. Knowledge of ESG and its application in building a portfolio. Ability to perform under pressure on a trading desk. Proficient in computer modeling and spreadsheet analysis. Financial programming skills are an asset.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of global credit markets analyzing a variety of industries and with an established professional network across global credit markets.
  • Highly driven, intellectually curious, collaborative within a team culture while also able to work independently and has effective time management skills. Ability to multi-task and work independently in a rapidly changing environment
  • Your influence makes an impact. Strong communication skills both written and verbal, effective to influencing colleagues.
  • You give meaning to data. Ability to understand/explain/resolve complex issues; strong problem-solving and reasoning skills.
  • Undergraduate, graduate and/or post-graduate degrees in management, finance, accounting or a STEM discipline.  Strong financial and accounting skills. Completion of CFA preferred.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.
  • Location is flexible between Toronto and Montreal

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

item.title: Identity Theft Response Representative
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

You’ll work in the Fraud Contact Centre team. As an Identity Theft Response officer, you will be responsible for ensuring the delivery of service to both external and internal customers consistent with CIBC’s vision of winning customer loyalty through service excellence. You’ll use extensive analytical ability, resolve all complex or difficult problems relating to Fraud Applications, Account Takeovers, Convenience Cheques, and Payments referred by other areas of CIBC or other external sources (law enforcement, other financial institutions, etc.), as well as from our monitoring systems (Capstone, Falcon, Gemini & Hawk). You must be willing and able to participate in the CIBC Agent @ Home program. Contact Centre business hours are from Monday to Sunday, 7:00AM – 12:00AM. 

CIBC is transitioning to an Agent @ Home model,  for this role you may be required to work from home at some point in this process. The expectation and details will be confirmed if you moved through the recruitment process. Even though this role may be a remote position - the expectation is that you must be able to attend your primary CIBC location within two hours upon request (e.g. technology/service outages, Business Contingency Planning, team meetings, celebration, events, etc.)

Agent @ Home Program Requirements

  • Ability to work independently as an Agent @ Home with a secure workspace, in a room or office with a door that closes it off from noises and distractions.

  • Wired Internet connection, capable of continuously supporting excellent call quality and high-speed response rate (Internet connection can be connected to modem through hard cable (not wireless) with a minimum download speed of 15 mbps and upload speed of 10 mbps)

How You’ll Succeed

  • Problem Solving - Determine the legitimacy of applications by contacting applicants, employers, branches, other financial institutions, credit bureaus, as well as gathering and analyzing documents for potential fraud. Conduct in depth and thorough investigations into possible fraud trends, potential fraudulent applications, cheques, payments and possible account takeovers referred or identified within, Falcon, or internal and external sources. Take appropriate action on any escalated complaints received from cardholders or other sources.

  • Product Knowledge - Provide recommendations on operational and system procedures that support early detection of fraud by being fully conversant with all VISA products, procedures and policies related to Fraud Detection to ensure that all duties are performed with up-to-date and approved methods. Use sound judgment and take appropriate actions in closing and declining VISA accounts and applications in order to prevent further losses and protect the integrity of the bank.

  • Influencing Skills - Provide recommendations on operational and system procedures that support early detection of fraud. Contribute to the enhancement of the team focus through participation in special projects, temporary assignments, meetings, and any additional activities delegated by management. 

Who You Are

  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.

  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.

  • You can demonstrate experience in in a fraud prevention, loss prevention, or investigative role. You have working knowledge of PRM, TSYS, AS400 Image and COINS/ECIF.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

item.title: Contact Centre Investment Team - Mutual Funds Representative
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

You’ll join the Contact Centre Investment Team. As a Mutual Funds Representative you will focus on providing an excellent client experience, by recognizing opportunities to promote CIBC investment products and services that help clients achieve their financial goals.  You will be responding to client inquiries related to mutual fund and fixed term investments and provide detailed and in-depth information on products and services.

CIBC is transitioning to an Agent @ Home model,  for this role you will be required to work from home at some point in this process. The expectation and details will be confirmed if you moved through the recruitment process. Even though this role is a remote position - the expectation is that you must be able to attend your primary CIBC location within two hours upon request (e.g. technology/service outages, Business Contingency Planning, team meetings, celebration, events, etc.)

We want to hear from you if:  

  • You must be willing and able to participate in the CIBC Agent @ Home program
  • You go the extra mile, because it’s the right thing to do. 
  • You are ambitious and you love to learn. 
  • You are motivated to make a difference. 
  • You love to surround yourself with people who challenge you. 
  • You listen and learn from the diverse experience of others. 
  • You bring the best of yourself to work

Agent @ Home Program Requirements

  • Ability to work independently as an Agent @ Home with a secure workspace, in a room or office with a door that closes it off from noises and distractions.

  • Wired Internet connection, capable of continuously supporting excellent call quality and high-speed response rate (Internet connection can be connected to modem through hard cable (not wireless) with a minimum download speed of 15 mbps and upload speed of 10 mbps)

 

If this sounds like you, but you’re not sure if you’re ready to be on the frontlines of client service, we’ve got you covered. You’ll  begin your journey with an industry-leading paid training program that runs about 1-2 months. 

  • Your training will get you equipped with the skills and knowledge to provide the best possible experience to CIBC clients – we know there’s a learning curve and we’re here to help. 
  • You’ll initially participate in approximately five to six weeks of training with a mix of in-class learning and on-the-job application - typically from Monday to Friday.
  • It’s hands-on, so you’ll get the real-life experience you need to rise to the challenge.  

 

A quick note on your availability – our Contact Centre is open Monday to Friday, 8:00 am to 8:00 pm. We’d like for you to be flexible between these hours. 

   

How You’ll Succeed                                                                               

  • Client Engagement – Build rapport and establish positive working relationships with clients by using discovery questions and industry standard Know Your Client (KYC) questions to determine client needs and provide information on the right investment products or services.
  • Product Knowledge - Provide detailed, factual and/or technical information on Savings, Income, Growth, Index and Managed Portfolio Solutions for various Mutual Fund account types. Open new Mutual Funds accounts and complete Mutual Fund transactions on existing accounts, including purchases, redemptions and transfers (buying and selling) from one fund to another by following all MFDA rules and regulations and completing a KYC before each interaction.
  • Problem Solving - Listen, ask questions, and put yourself in the client’s shoes. Act like an owner by taking accountability for client issues, and know when to lean on others to find the right solutions. Recognize and act on opportunities to engage clients in discussions of additional CIBC products and services.

Who You Are

  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it’s the right thing to do.
  • You’re driven to succeed. You are motivated by accomplishing your goals and delivering your best to make an impact.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • You’re a certified professional. You have current accreditation and good standing Mutual Funds License (Canadian Securities Course or Investment Funds In Canada).
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

item.title: Senior Designer, Training & Development
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

Canadian Commercial Banking and Wealth Management provides high-touch, relationship-oriented commercial and private banking, as well as wealth management services to meet the needs of middle-market companies, entrepreneurs, high-net-worth individuals and families, along with institutional clients across Canada.

CIBC Private Wealth Management delivers customized banking, financial planning, investment management and specialized advisory solutions to meet the unique needs of Canada’s high net worth individuals, families, private holding companies, trusts, estates, charitable foundations and First Nations. 

CIBC Private Wealth Management is comprised of the following lines of business:

  • CIBC Private Banking – Exclusive personal service for high net worth individuals providing comprehensive financial advice and solutions in cash management, foreign exchange, credit and investments.
  • CIBC Investment Counsel (CPIC) - Provides discretionary investment management expertise and tailored portfolios.
  • CIBC Trust - Provides professional estate administration, power-of-attorney, and trustee services with expertise in tax reporting, property management, and investment management.  
  • CIBC Financial Planning – Works in partnership with CIBC advisors to provide clients with expert financial planning and specialized investment, retirement and estate planning solutions.

What You’ll Be Doing

Reporting to the Executive Director, Training & Development, the Senior Designer, Training & Development is responsible for contributing to the strategic direction of the Training and Practice Management programs and content for CIBC Private Wealth Management. The Senior Designer plays a key role in designing, developing, and maintaining content and supporting materials leveraged by the training and practice management teams for all Private Wealth Management business units.  The focus is to work primarily on Private Banking and other Private Wealth Management lines of business by providing a high-quality learner experience through the design and development of programs, workshops and support material while increasing sales force capability and business practices to increase sales force effectiveness. In addition, the role is responsible for aligning planning with all business units.

How you’ll succeed

  • Collaboration with Key Partners for Program Design Work- Work in collaboration with the Executive Director, Directors, Program Mangers of Training & Development/Practice Management Consultants and Private Wealth Management partners to design and develop programs/ resources based on the strategic priorities of the business. Following a disciplined approach, work with the training/practice management contact to develop the strategy to address the learner needs creating a best-in-class employee experience. Design and develop the content/materials and ongoing coaching support tools leveraging the Practice Management Framework and existing materials, ensuring consistent and significant focus on leveraging adult learning principles. Bring our purpose behaviours (Always Professional, Radically Simple, Genuinely Caring) to life to deliver on our client commitments.  Identify and update any existing material that is impacted by the initiative. Develop a feedback loop and work with the training/practice management contact to continually enhance the material based on feedback.  Proactively identify areas of opportunities to enhance training/practice management support by leveraging sales force analytics (PriceMetrics, reporting) and feedback from the Managing Directors, Branch leadership, Advisors, and the team.
  • Explore innovative ways to deliver content & tools- Work with the Executive Director, Training & Development to explore innovative ways to deliver content and develop tools to support the Training & Practice Management teams.  Keep informed on industry changes and best practices that support Advisor excellence and best in class client experience.
  • Maintain a centralized inventory of material to create efficiencies and consistency across the teams
  • Includes a repository for training programs (including licensing), workshops, support material leveraged internally and by advisor teams
  • Ensure Records Retention standards are adhered to for all material and programs
  • Repurpose and reuse content/material to reduce "one-off" production when making recommendations
  • Follow the record retention process and implement administrative processes that are effective and create efficiencies 

  • Content Management & Maintenance- Manage and maintain content on the PWM intranet and Workday (corporate Learning Management System) that supports the PWM Training & Development and Practice Management teams. Keep apprised of changes/ standards set by the CIBC intranet team/ Talent Development. Update and understand how strategic initiatives impact existing material and programs.  Keep up to date on best practices to ensure we are leveraging the resources to create a positive employee experience. Work in collaboration with key partners (Marketing, Wealth Solutions, Business Risk, etc) to ensure content/supporting documents are aligned and kept up to date with changes.  Develop relationships with key partners to build awareness of initiatives that may impact content.  Work in collaboration with key partners by providing insight and expertise on strategic initiatives on behalf of the Training/Practice Management teams.
  • Business Growth & Operational Effectiveness- Be a key participant on the training team to support key Private Wealth Management goals. Work collaboratively with the Executive Directors, Training & Practice Management along with Private Wealth leadership to align with the overall strategic direction.  Implement and adhere to CIBC wide policies and regulatory requirement. You will devote time to strategic policy, regulatory, audit and compliance matters.

Who You Are

  •  You can demonstrate 8-10 years of experience in the industry with highly developed knowledge of the wealth management business. You have previous design and development experience leveraging various authoring tools such as Microsoft Office and Sharepoint. 
  • You have an undergraduate degree in business or economics, MBA is an asset.
  • You are a bold and authentic leader. You\'re passionate about developing and coaching to bring out the best in people. You possess the ability to identify business opportunities and implement successful strategies.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard. You have well developed communication/presentation skills both orally and written. You have strong influencing skills & business acumen to be able to collect information, analyze and manipulate the data. You can apply these analytical/conceptual skills in creative ways to solve business issues/challenges & problems. 
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do. You have strong awareness of business issues, processes, and outcomes as they impact Wood Gundy/Private Wealth management and our clients.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

        Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You\'ll Be Doing

You’ll be joining CIBC’s Equities Market Technology Group and be at the heart of CIBC’s digital transformation, successfully delivering complex, enterprise-scale mobile projects involving multiple back-end systems. As an Senior Consultant, Application Development you will build, implement and maintain easy, flexible, and personalized solutions that enhance the client experience. You’ll lead the planning and strategy for the technical design, development and integration.

How You\'ll Succeed

  • Programming Skills - Develop code and test computer programs for straightforward assignments. Review, analyze, and modify programming systems, including encoding, testing, and debugging.

  • Systems Implementation - Participate in the technical design, development, and integration of cross functional, multi-platform application systems.

  • Planning and Coordination - Effectively interact with stakeholders, end users, business analysts, and technical resources to gather requirements and prepare design specifications as instructed by senior team members.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience with:  Practical software development experience utilizing Java with strong knowledge of Spring/SpringBoot/Spring Integration/Spring Batch, Microservices Architecture and Cloud-native (5 years’ Java programming preferred, however recent graduates may also apply).  This role requires effective solution and design expertise needed to solve complex problems. Ideally, you are familiar with JavaScript application frameworks (e.g. Angular) and have experience with databases (Oracle/LDAP/SQL Server).  It’s an asset if: You have previous experience with ETL knowledge. Experience with Capital Markets is also preferred.

  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.

  • You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.

  • You’re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.

  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, and individual development planning

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-22 Front St., 2nd

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

item.title: Senior Test Coordinator (QE Lead)
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

As a Senior Test Coordinator (QE Lead), you will join CIBC’s Personal and Small Business Technology (PSBT) Team. You’ll be hands on lead of the QA/QE Programs planning, development, execution and integration into existing QA / QE processes for assigned projects and QA Transformation. As a Sr. Test Coordinator you will also build, implement, execute, and maintain robust, repeatable, scalable automation solutions that enhance the PSBT QA functional test team capabilities.

  

How You’ll Succeed:

  • Teamwork & Partnering: Ability to establish and build healthy working relations and partnerships with clients, vendors and peers. You will work with partners internally to understand the automation needs and process flows required as well as internally/externally managing automation solutions with vendor teams as required.
  • Decision Making and Critical Thinking - Demonstrate knowledge of tools and techniques for effective use of a broad range of factors, assumptions, frameworks and perspectives when solving problems.
  • Collaboration: Work with business and technical teams to establish test plans, standards, and procedures that add value to software project and satisfy the constraints of the project by reviewing project documentation.
  • Testing: Execute tests and ensure results achieve documented goals and objectives.
  • Drive Automated Testing: Create, maintain and execute test automation scripts; contribute to the development of test automation frameworks to drive continuous improvement. Report and manage software concerns and test activities throughout the software development lifecycle. Provide status of testing, communicate issues, implement QA standards and policies, and communicate QA schedule.
  • Monitor & Reporting: Monitor project adherence to quality standards and provide status reporting as needed. Adhere to CIBC’s processes through all phases of the software development life cycle.
  • Planning and Coordination - Interact with stakeholders, end users, business/test analysts, and technical resources to gather requirements and prepare test specifications as instructed by senior team members.
  • Leadership Skills – Offer guidance and support. Provide tactical, informed recommendations to senior management, and keep up to date on current technology trends.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience and strong skills in functional and automated testing methodologies. You \'re an expert in automation and software process improvement through 5+ years of experience in  application system manual or automation testing and quality assurance processes, best practices and tools. 2-3+ years’ experience with Selenium.  2-3+ years’ experience with any of the following HP ALM, Jira, SOAP UI, Parasoft SOATest, scripting languages including Python, Java, or equivalent. You have experience leading QA Programs. Previous experience in a software testing capacity with automation exposure. Experience working with databases and exposure to testing complex User Interfaces and User Experience journeys via user interfaces.  It’s an asset if you have experience with Model Based Testing. It is an advantage if you have experience within an Agile environment.
  • It’s an advantage if: Insert project & tool specific experience, if applicable (for e.g. offshore vendor experience, SOAP Sonar, Payments experience)
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success.  You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of a team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision. You are passionate about client service -  You want  the work you do each day to result in a  positive client experience.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, and individual development planning.
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
